They know the ways of spirits and nature. You can learn a lot from them just by listening. Still, you can always learn a lot if you're listening well to what nature tells you.
Better ask the Southerners about that one.
A weapon hardly useful for a hunter.
The wolves are very hungry lately.
I don't think I'd like that place and it's not only that this is not my marked territory.
Only foreigners talk about that place now and then.
I admire the safety of the burrow and the closeness of the pack. It's a good thing to have a lair to which you can withdraw to lick your wounds.
Thais is some far away city.
Carlin and Venore seem to live in some sort of rivalry.
There are no monsters. It's only a matter of being hunting or being hunted.
We have many enemies but our spirit and our bodies are strong. We are fit enough to survive.
I think there is no such creature. The Southerners are just making up those stories.
Most dwarfs I've seen seem to lack the stealthiness to become a good hunter.
Elves are good hunters. Even I was able to learn something from the elves that came here. I am thinking about visiting their city some day.
The chakoya are ferocious hunters. They don't only kill out of hunger, they love the carnage they are causing.
Yetis are rare but they do exist. Everyone that has been hunting in the frozen wastes for some time can share stories of their sightings.
It's not easy to hunt dragons. Suddenly, a hunter might become the hunted in their lairs.
I don't know anything about it.
Being a barbarian means to be one with nature and its instincts.
You will have to speak with our jarl Sven to begin the barbarian test.
Our city benefits much from the strength and wisdom of our jarl. He is a great top dog who knows what is best for his kin.
Our jarl was a great hunter in his younger days. He is still my idol.
Their packs are not of our kin anymore. They left our pack. We will see how they prosper. They have nothing to expect from us except for cold steel in their hearts.
The camps of the raiders are to the south. Although, you can find hunting parties almost everywhere on those isles.
As far as I have understood it, they are of some importance for the people of Carlin.
Father north wind knows best.
An isle on which the shamans live.
I wonder if even bigger hunter have driven them away.
I only feel alive when I'm on a hunt. But even I need some time to rest and regain strength.
Good hunting, Player.

conversation.Pemaret: Passages to Edron and Eremo's Island. Also selling fresh fish!
Greetings, young man. Looking for a passage or some fish, Player?
My fish is of the finest quality you could find. Ask me for a trade to check for yourself.
I'm a fisherman and I take along people to Edron. You can also buy some fresh fish.
My name is Pemaret, the fisherman.
My boat is ready to bring you to Edron.
I love to sail on the seas of Tibia.
Now that's a special one. Where did you hear about it? I would be interested, you know... Well, this fish is extremely rare and cannot be found in normal, clean freshwater. ...
If you want to catch one, you will have to look for a really dirty lake. If you were able to catch one however, this would be a very versatile haul. ...
It is said that, in combination with certain magical or non-magical items, this fish somehow... changes his looks and gains a completely new purpose. I heard of someone making a weapon out of it! ...
Hey, don't look at me like that. It... it's just a tale what do I know. ...
Anyway, I heard of people using flintstones, the hair and wax of strange creatures I never saw before, an eye of a foreign sea beast and some kind of old, broken ring.
It's a lovely and peaceful isle. Did you already visit the nice sandy beach?
Do you want to get to Edron for 10 gold?
Oh, you know the good old sage Eremo. I can bring you to his little island. Do you want me to do that?
I love to sail on the seas of Tibia.
Good bye, Player. You are welcome.

conversation.A Majestic Warwolf: Interesting. A human who can speak the language of wolves.
I can see in your eyes that you are a honest and friendly person, Player. You were patient enough to learn our language and I will grant you a special gift. Will you accept it?
From now on, you shall be known as Player, the bear warrior. You shall be strong and proud as Angros, the great dark bear. He shall guide your path.

conversation.Ghostly Wolf: You are speaking the language of animals? I'm surprised. But I'm not in the right mood for a chat.
I'm heartbroken. My puppies were taken from me ... But as I said, I don't want to talk right now. Please leave me alone.
I'm a wolf ... or I was one. Now I'm a ghost, haunting this place because I can't find peace.
Time is not important, neither to wolves nor to ghosts.

conversation.Yoem: Hello Player! Do you need some equipment for your house?
My name is Yoem. I sell furniture and equipment.
Have you moved to a new home? I'm the specialist for equipping it.
Yes, I know him since we were small children. He's a brave and virtuous man.

Yes, the Curse of the Full Moon has reached Cormaya, too. More and more people are affected but something is really strange: Some of them weren't bitten by were-beasts. So far we thought this is the only way to be infected. ...
But now it's obvious that there has to be another way. If you ask me: I guess it's the ground water. Someone has to enter the caverns underneath Cormaya and investigate. ...
In the east of the island there are tunnels where we often spot were-beasts at night. Perhaps you should start there.

So I was right, it is the ground water! Please try to reverse this contamination. Unfortunately, I don't know anything about magic or arcane matters. But you could ask somebody at the Magic Academy of Edron.
You succeeded! Thank you very much for your help, my friend. Please return to Edron and tell Daniel Steelsoul about it, he will be interested in this outcome, too.

conversation.Falk: LONG LIVE KING TIBIANUS! Welcome to the isle of Edron!
I'm the Edron harbour guard. I protect Edron castle and inform visitors about this building and Edron itself.
I'm Lieutenant Falk.
Sorry, that's confidential.
The mysterious isle has many secrets and sights outside the castle. The areas of interest are in the west, the southwest, the north, and the northwest.
The Edron castle is the home of many shops, a tavern, a bank, a depot, a post office and the temple of Banor's blood.
We all live under the benevolent guidance of our king.
The shops are on the eastern side of the castle. Upstairs you'll find a tailor, a blacksmith, and an equipment store.
I'm well prepared for my duty.
Visit the shopkeepers to buy their fine wares.
LONG LIVE THE KING!
The local army consists only of the Knights of Banor's Blood.
The tavern is called the Horn of Plenty, and it's located upstairs in the southwest corner of the castle.
You'll find the bank in the southwest of the castle. Look for Ebenizer, you can't miss him.
The post office, run by the lovely Chrystal is in the southwest corner of the castle, near the Royal Bank.
The temple can be found underground, in the southeast corner of the castle. There you can become a citizen of Edron.
There are rumours of orc buildings in the southeast. They say some daring fellows found a passage to this area in an old cavern beneath the Edron flats.
Don't even think about going there. Renegade Knights of Banor's Blood went there to unearth forbidden secrets in an ancient ruin.
In the north, there is an ancient city of cyclopses, called the cyclopolis. They are wary of us, but trade with servants of evil from any known race.
There are rumours of two tribes of minor monsters who battle each other for dominance over the area. Not worth to crawl the sewers to get there.
In the city there is a furniture store and a jeweller. The Noodles Academy and the cemetary are outside.
The Noodles Academy of the magic arts is in the east of Edron city.
Explore the isle and destroy any enemy forces encountered. The honor shall be your reward.
The cemetery is north of the hamlet of Stonehome, which is at the east coast, northeast of Edron city. The cemetary is rumoured to be haunted.
There are the Dogs of War, the Red Guards, and the Silver Guards.
LONG LIVE THE KING!

conversation.Daniel Steelsoul: Greetings and Banor with you, Player!
I am Sir Daniel Steelsoul of the Sacred Order of Banor's Blood.
I am the governor of this isle, Edron, and grandmaster of the Knights of Banor's Blood.
The castle was built on elder foundations we found on this isle.
Evil challenges the forces of good in any shape. Be it the claws of vicious monsters or the seductive dark secrets of rotten power.
With this weapon in my hand, I would teach the servants of darkness the true meaning of the word fear.
We cleansed the south of any major enemy, but watch out while travelling the north.
Are you suggesting I am corruptible?
Take this!
Look for Willard, our local blacksmith.
I belong to a sacred order and don't care about mundane politics.
With the Thaian army bound to other duties, our order was entrusted to secure the area. We defeated the evil minotaurs living right here and cleansed the isle of their unholy presence.
It is a peaceful isle next to Edron with a nice village. You should visit the wonderful garden there.
This isle is rumored to have been the home of a powerful ancient race which became extinct before the corpsewars. It was up to King Tibianus III to reclaim it for humanity and to found this colony.
Now and then a dwarf comes to this isle. Most behave secretive about their reason to come here. As far as I can tell, they are looking for some dwarfish artifact which was lost in ancient times.
He was my second in command. After learning about the forbidden ruins, he, the priestess Agaltha, and their followers freed the criminals we brought here as workers and headed to the north.
She was beautiful but seemed cold hearted. She spoke little to me, preferred the company of Kaine.
An ancient taboo forbids to enter the northern ruins.
We thought it was only superstition and no one bothered that Kaine and his friends went there to hunt servants of evil that might have hidden there. So we did not notice the dark cult they started.
We know only little about them. Kaine and his fallen knights were joined by criminals and remaining forces of darkness that escaped us. They were joined by some ominous dark monks.
We don't know if they came here or already hid in the ruins when we arrived. Maybe they seduced Kaine or Agaltha, maybe they were theirs for years.

After the treason of Kaine, we observe these mages closely. If even a knight falls prey to the seduction of the forbidden ruins, no one can tell how easy some of these mystics might betray his people.
The rotten cyclops worship the raging giant of hell.
Do not mention the name of the cursed one!
The army protects the Thaian realm. The order of the Knights of Banor's Blood supports them with all our skills.
We believe that the blood of Banor runs through the veins of all humans. Therefore, we are responsible to live up to Banors standards and not to stain his legacy with sinful acts.
Only those who live a life of bravery, honour, and piety may join our sacred order.
You may join the order of Banor's blood if you prove your honour.
The Order of the Falcon inhabited an impressive stronghold here in Edron. It lies dormant ever since the disappearance of the order and is unlikely to ever be used again. ...
Not many even go near the thing, especially during the night. They told stories about weird lights at the tower after midnight since I was a child. I never saw any myself, naturally.
I think this nun might be a bit young for this position, but I won't question the decisions of the church of Banor's Blood.
His spirit and blood are within us. Honour this fact or be cast into hell.
He and his men fought against Ferumbras somewhere in the north of this isle, long before there were even plans of a colony. Only old Ben returned alive from the battle, but his mind was broken.
Eremo is a very wise man. I visit him sometimes on his little island near Edron. Just ask a fisherman for a passage.
Pemaret is a fisherman on Cormaya.
A promising young fellow.
He searched something in the north of the isle years ago. Probably he needed something from the forbidden ruins. He was chased and fought by the troops of general Benjamin.
Harkath Bloodblade declined the governorship because he's needed more in Thais.
I hardly find the time to visit the tavern.
When he was young, Willard served in the royal army.
The minotaurs, though evil, were worthy opponents. After the treason of the man who is now known as Kaine Kinslayer, we lack the manpower to crush their cyclopean allies, too.
They live in an underground city, known as Cyclopolis in the north of the isle. Constantly forging weapons for the servants of darkness.

You could call her the protector of Grimvale. When she was a girl she lived in Edron with her parents, thus I know her from my days of childhood. Later she moved to Grimvale but now and again she used to visit Edron. ...
But lately I haven't seen her all too often. I guess the unsettling occurrences on Grimvale demand all of her attention.
Grimvale is a small island in the north-east of Edron. Its few inhabitants live quite out of the world but for a long time it was a peaceful place. However, this might have changed lately.

Rumour has it that some of the inhabitants are affected by were-sickness. And yes, I believe it. Not because I am of a facile nature, no. Rather because there are strange things happening right here on Edron that teach me better.

With each full moon monsters are roaming the woods. They look like badgers and foxes who are transforming into humans. Unfortunately it's the other way round: Peaceful citizens transform into feral beasts as soon as the moon is full.

Yes, recently we have a major problem here on Edron. Strange proceedings are troubling me as well as the common citizens. With each full moon, monsters are roaming the woods - monsters that we only knew from tales until now. ...
They look like badgers and foxes who are transforming into humans. Unfortunately, it's the other way round: Peaceful citizens transform into feral beasts as soon as the moon is full. ...

Some hunters even claim that they have spotted monstrous humanoid boars, wolves and bears. I know what is going on on Grimvale so I sent a messenger to Maeryn. She confirmed what I already feared: Those creatures are were-beasts. ...
The so-called Curse of the Full Moon is spreading and reached Edron. I asked Maeryn for help but she has plenty of trouble on Grimvale and can't leave the island. ...
Do you know something about this curse and - even more important - would you be willing to help us?

I'm very relieved to hear that. The most important thing right now is to cure the curse of as many affected people as possible. Maeryn already told me that the purple nightshade is able to revert the effects of lycanthropy. ...

We tried this but it worked only partially. Strangely, we were able to cure the people living outside the town in the more rural parts of Edron. But there are also some affected people in the town itself and the nightshade doesn't have any effect....
I'm neither a sage nor a magician. But I'm the one who is supposed to find a solution for this problem. Please pay a visit to the Magic Academy of Edron. Perhaps one of the mages there can help you.
I'm very happy that you could help the people of Cormaya. May Banor bless you. But I have one last request: The were-beasts are led by alpha leaders. ...

Please seek out the subterranean caves of the lycanthropes on Edron and Cormaya and kill the alpha leader of each kind of were-beast, five altogether. This should weaken them enough to hold them at bay for quite a while.
You defeated the five alpha leaders! Well done, this should weaken them enough to hold them at bay for quite a while. Please take this pendant in return, it may be of use for you. ...

The were-sickness won't disappear completely but it will be easier for us now. At least I hope so! Yesterday a travelling salesman told me that he spotted a feral creature in the Darama desert that looked like half man and half lion. ...
Banor grant that this is just unfounded gossip and that the curse didn't spread further. Well, I guess, we will find out soon. Edron, for the time being, is a safer place now, thanks to you.
Thank you again for your assistance, Player! The Curse of the Full Moon still exists on Edron. But thanks to your heroic deeds we can keep it within certain bounds. At least I hope so! ...

Yesterday a travelling salesman told me that he spotted a feral creature in the Darama desert that looked like half man and half lion. Banor grant that this is just unfounded gossip and that the curse didn't spread further. ...
Well, I guess, we will find out soon. Edron, for the time being, is a safer place now, thanks to you.
Lately I heard rumours about the curse. That it has spread to the Darama Desert and that the lions there could also be were-creatures. Do you want to get to the bottom of it?
Then please travel to Darashia and search for a man called Domizian. He lives in a house at the harbour. I know him for many years, he's a trustworthy friend. ...
I'm sure, he can tell you more about the curse in the Darama Desert.
PRAISE TO BANOR!

conversation.Avar Tar: Greetings, fellow traveller Norghin!
Wherever the army fails, a hero like me is needed.
In order to get the demon outfit, you have to prove yourself worthy, Norghin. Finish the annihilator quest and you will receive the demon base outfit.
I saved the women there once or twice.
Demons know and fear my name! It’s not always easy to be a hero, you know?
I am sure it’s hidden in a vault of the Nightmare Knights beneath the Plains of Havoc. I’m planning an expedition to go there and to rout out the Ruthless Seven, but I have to save the world first.
The Order of the Falcon, a quest for true chivalric virtues indeed! Unfortunately the order has all but disappeared long before my time. …
Their stronghold is still intact, however, just head north from Edron. But be careful, something is not right with the place.
I fought him several times, sometimes he killed me, sometimes I killed him. I’d say we are even right now, but I’m getting better and more powerful each day.
In order to get the helmet of the demon outfit, you have to prove yourself worthy, Norghin. Finish the demon oak quest and you will receive the demon outfit’s helmet.
I think I’m the greatest hero in Tibia, but my humility forbids me to make an issue out of it.
I’m a professional hero.
I’m on a quest for the Thaian king … as usual.
I had to master the magic of all 4 vocations for one of the quests.
I’m Avar Tar, slayer of monsters, saviour of princesses, and defender of the weak.
There is a great evil lurking beneath this isle … and beneath the Plains of Havoc, and in the ancient necropolis, and beneath the Ghostlands … well, basically everywhere.
Don’t be afraid! As long as I stand guard here, the beast won’t reach the town!
I’m tired of all these young unskilled wannabe heroes. Every Tibian can show his skills or actions by wearing a special outfit. To prove oneself worthy of the demon outfit, this is how it goes: …
The base outfit will be granted for completing the annihilator quest, which isn’t much of a challenge nowadays, in my opinion. Anyway …
The shield however will only be granted to those adventurers who have finished the demon helmet quest. …
Well, the helmet is for those who really are tenacious and have hunted down all 6666 demons and finished the demon oak as well. …
Are you interested?
I tire of you little pranksters trying to waste my time.
I’m so tired of quests. I solved them all, most of them several times!
Rookgaard is full of memories of my first heroic accomplishments …
I heard that after all these years, the minotaur mage there refuses to leave his room as he is still afraid of me.
Oh, come on. Let the noobs take care of them. Call me if they are fourteen or so.
In order to get the shield of the demon outfit, you have to prove yourself worthy, Norghin. Finish the demon helmet quest and you will receive the shield.
Ah, my trusty old sword. I left it on Rookgaard years ago when I left for the main continent.
If I had time, I would restore peace in this once proud city, but there’s too much to do before I can start that quest.
I’ve seen it all and done it all … at least twice.
It’s 12:00 am right now.
They might be a nice way for weaker heroes to prove their skill.
See you later, Norghin.

conversation.Amanda: Welcome to the temple of Banor's blood Player. If you are heavily wounded or poisoned, I can heal you.
I'm a humble nun that came to Edron to help.
I'm sister Amanda.
Sorry, I rarely have time to chat.
Now, it is horas.

Our king is a religious man - a shining example.
Our army lives in accordance with the ideals of the god Banor.
Edron is in grave danger. I arrived here too late to witness the events myself, but I will share everything with you that I've heard ...
A false priestess seduced some knights to abandon their noble cause and to free some prisoners. Then they headed to some ruins in the North where they practice a dark cult and consort with demons.
The ruins are probably older than humankind. We have to assume it's a place of dark power. The recent appearances of the fiend Orshabaal hint that the Ruthless Seven are somehow involved.
The taint he spreads on the land is unbearable. This creature has to be destroyed once and for all.
I'm not sure if they even exist. Demons usually don't form such partnerships.
It takes heroes to defeat demons!
Heroes gain equipment and experience by fulfilling dangerous quests.
That's our world.
We can expect little help from Thais in these troubled days. We need some heroes to help us with these sinister things going on here.
They created the world and all life on it.
Farewell, Player!

conversation.Shoddy Beggar: What do you want? Listen to the old madman? If you have nothing to spare, leave me alone.
Soldiers… learning ways to fight monsters instead of fighting to learn the way to the root of all this evil.
I thought this was the city of knowledge, arts and exploration. Instead I found this academy full of… *mumbles*
I heard about the legend, but I don’t know how much of it is actually true.

Mean, heartless… go and leave me be.

conversation.Maeryn: Greetings! We are still fighting the Curse of the Full Moon.
My name is Maeryn.
I'm the protector of this little village. A bit of a self-proclaimed function, I admit, but someone has to watch over Grimvale. It is a dangerous place.
The small island you are standing on. For a long time it was a peaceful and placid place. But lately it has become more dangerous.

So you don't know it yet. This island, Grimvale, is affected by were-sickness. Many pitiful, who are stricken with the curse, dwell in the tunnels and caverns underneath the village and the nearby hurst.
Yes, pitiful. For they are savage beasts now who regularly come up from below to attack the village. But once they were inhabitants of Grimvale, before they changed.

Through a bite or even a scratch, you may be infected with the were-sickness. If that happens, there is little hope - until the next full moon you'll change into a were-creature, depending on the animal that hurt you.
There is a plant, the purple nightshade. It blossoms exclusively in the light of the full moon and only underground, where the full moon's light is falling through fissures
It transforms peaceful villagers into savage beasts. We're not sure how this curse found the way into our small village. But one day it began. At first it befell just a few people. ...
In a full moon night they changed into bears and wolves, and tore apart their unsuspecting relatives while they were asleep. ...
Those merely wounded, first thought they were lucky. But then we realised they were changing, too. Later, others assumed the forms of badgers and boars also. ...
But that does not mean they were any less wild or dangerous than the others.
We are not sure what they are doing down there. We're glad if they stay in the caverns and leave us alone. Only at full moon do they come up and threaten the island's surface and village. ...
I, however, have a hunch as to why they dwell so deep under the earth.
There are old legends about a subterranean temple that was once built in this area. Supposedly many artefacts are still hidden down there. ...
I don't have the time to tell you the entire tale, but there is a book downstairs in which you may read the whole story.

Yes, the story goes that there are ancient artefacts still hidden in the temple ruins, such as helmets in the form of wolven heads, for example. It is said that moonlight crystals are needed to enchant these artefacts.

The moonlight crystals are extremely rare. Supposedly they resemble berg crystal but have a more silvery gleam. My grandmother once told me that they may be used to enchant amulets or other things. But I don't know, whether this is true or just a fable.
Every month around the 13th, the single Tibian moon will by fully visible to us. That's when the curse hits us hardest.

The two days around the 13th, the 12th and the 14th, are considered 'Harvest Moon', those are the best to gather nightshade. However, only after it has reached its apex on the 13th, the curse strengthens.
We do not know what happens down there in those tunnels around that time but there is a presence there, we all feel - yet cannot quite fathom. ...
At full moon, humans transform into wild beasts: wolves, boars, bears and others. Some call it the Curse of the Full Moon, others think it is a kind of sickness. ...
During this time, we try to not leave the house, we shut the windows and hope it will pass. The curse will weaken a bit after that but it returns.
Three of these blossoms should suffice to heal some afflicted persons. But if you bring more I'd be grateful, of course.
He's basically a ferryman nowadays, but I remember when he was our village's leading fisherman. He offers a ferry service between Grimvale and Edron. You must have met him - he sailed you here.
Farewell, then.

conversation.Sinclair: Greetings Player. I have – very – little time, please make it as short as possible. I may be able to help you if you are here to help us with any of our tasks or missions.

We are still in need of more research concerning environmental as well as psychic ecto-magical influences. Besides more common ghosts, we also need some of the harder to come by nightstalkers and – if you’re really hardboiled – souleaters. …
We will of course pay for every ghost you catch. You will receive more if you hunt for some of the tougher fellows – but don’t overdo it. What do you say?
There is indeed something you could do for us. We are still in need of more research concerning environmental as well as psychic ecto-magical influences.
My name is Sinclair. Pleased to meet you. Now where was I – oh yes.
I’m one of the few leading scientists in the field of ecto-magical research and development. There is a lot of work to do, time is very precious right now and we have practically no supporters.
I’m a scientist in the field of ecto-magical research and development. But curses are not my subject. Talk to Thomas, he might know something.
My colleague and fellow campaigner in our quest to explore the world of the spirits. He was the first one I encountered actively interested in this field of science
We can work quite untroubled here in the university – at least for now.
Thais is a lively city, that’s for sure. Well, I’m not much a people person actually, so… maybe you should ask someone else about that.
Aren’t there several islands near Carlin? Hm, I wonder if one can find anything interesting there.
Its people are what we are doing all this for. All our research, all magical devices we create – it’s all for the purpose to do good in our world.
I erm – I’m not much of a politician I’m afraid.
In contrary to ghasts, ghosts are dangerous phenomena that can change their position, they wail and can even manipulate materia in the case of ‘poltergeists’. …

It is also possible to communicate with some of them, but be wary of their true evil nature and keep your distance. You may even encounter harmless ghosts out there. But those are very rare and usually tied to sad events.
Ghasts largely differ from ghosts in a way that they are almost always stationary, silent manifestations of a dead person or creature. They are also a common illusion poorly talented mages think of.
Apparitions can be visions – very similar to day-dreams – of spirits or ghostly phenomena. …
Those visions always feel very real, we tracked several cases where people were actually… ‘eaten’ by one of those. You should take them very seriously.
Spirits can be good and also evil. In common belief, spirits are often seen as guides or guardians of people. But there are many forms and types of them, and they often actively try to cause harm. …
We also use ‘spirit’ as a broader term to describe all sorts of ghosts, ghasts and apparitions here at the Spirithunters headquarters.
That’s currently Spectulus, me and – well, you of course!
Ah yes, an interesting legend. Don’t know any details, though.

First rule: every kill is justified in the arena. Otherwise, the PvP rules of your world will apply to the arena on your world. ...
As for the rest of the rules, the most important thing to know is that there is a time limit for each fight as well as right before a match. ...
After the fight has been initiated by giving me the necessary details, a timer will be started. ...
A fight is won if either only one player is left or only one team (at least one member of the team still standing at the end of a fight). ...
The fight will be canceled if the predetermined number of players for a fight does not show up in the anteroom. ...
If a fight is in progress but takes too long or no clear winner could be termined (this includes team fights were at least one member of both teams is still standing), it will be canceled as well.
Every premium player can participate in the arena. To initiate the arena, just talk to me and tell me if you want to play last man standing or a team deathmatch. ...
If the arena is not currently occupied you will then be able to tell me how many players will take part. You can also create one-on-one matches in both modes by adding only 2 players. ...
If you opted for a team deathmatch, you will have to select the members for each team by telling me the correct names. ...
After that you will have to specify the stakes for the fight.
I can give you information on stakes or how the prize money will be split in last man standing or team deathmatch mode.
Depending on the stake the initiating player has determined for a fight, each player will have to have this amount of gold on his or her bank account to take part. ...
As soon as the match starts (not while waiting or by entering an anteroom after the fight has been initiated), the money will be deducted. ...
Together, these stakes will add to the prize money, which will either go to the single winner of a last man standing fight or to the winning team in a team deathmatch. ...
If the match cannot be finished within the time limit, this money will be lost!

In a team deathmatch this money is split evenly among each player of the winning team (please note that the final share will be rounded down in case of uneven splits). ...
If a winning team consists of 5 players and only 2 members are still standing at the end of a fight, the money will still be split among all 5 members of the team.

Mh? Ah, yes yes. ‘Njey’ is the native-language term for a very old race of undersea creatures which …
…hm, wait – only a select few of my colleagues even bothered studying their culture. They are a mere fantasy to the common man – is there anything of importance you want to tell me?

Well, if you really want to delve into this – I could use some help. So you have found my machine on that island? And you found the notes with the coordinates? Then you can find the entrance! …

Just look for a large staircase with sprawling steps. There is an unpassable stream there that will prevent you from venturing further on. But fear not, you can indeed travel down there – with these small enhancements I created. …

I will put this under your footgear. Here you go. And this in your nose. There. And there will be no further problems for you down there. Except- ah, well you’ll find out yourself soon enough, won’t you?

Ah, the machine you found at that island. Well, I built this thing to venture far beneath the very soil we walk on. I suspected something there. Something deep down below. Something evil. Even more so than the dreaded bugs which are crawling my study. …
Drilling hole after hole only to get stuck in another hard, unbreakable sediment again and again, I was about to quit this pointless enterprise. …
However, the very last day I lingered on that island, I finally fell into a large hollow right under the beach. My drill was shattered and the machine was not mobile anymore. …

I am well aware that this may sound laughable now – at this part all of my colleagues burst into laughter anyway – but suddenly there were stairs. Incredibly large stairs that led to the underworld. A world deep under the sea – can you believe this?
Feeling the might of the stream when I entered the water at the top of these stairs, I was terrified by the immediate loss of control. …
Being dragged down into the depths, shocked, a desperate grasp to reach the stony steps above me literally saved my life. …
I decided that if I were ever again to venture anywhere near these waters, I would have to prepare myself in a proper way. At first I would need something to weight down my shoes. …

Then of course, I would need to find a way for me and a mount to breathe down there. At the same time such enhancements should not slow me down in any way or I would not be able to explore the area effectively. …

I finally opted for a trade-off. I used a most uncommon sponge I did some research on to wad my nose. This sponge is able to find just the elements necessary to survive in any substance I would inhale down there. It discards everything else. …

While I don’t understand the whole process yet, by doing so I can practically breathe underwater. An alloy of metal right under my shoes would help me to stand fast in all but the strongest of streams. …
And the downside? The downside is that it is impossible to swim with that stuff under your shoes.

To explain the infinity of parallel dimensions, please imagine the following. …
We are currently at a specific point in the flow of time. Let’s call it point ZERO at 12:00 o’clock. …
As time flows I might drop my pencil to the ground – so the flow of time and the events chained to it have gone in direction ONE which leads to 12:01 o’clock with a dropped pencil. …

Now let’s go back to point ZERO. I might also have just put it back into my pocket – the flow of time and its chain of events would have taken a ‘different’ direction, direction TWO – which leads to a 12:01 o’clock where I never dropped my pencil. …

Now imagine that ‘both’ directions actually exist – but you are only aware of one chain of events that has happened. The one where I dropped the pencil. And this is ‘your’ dimension, the one you are bound to. …
One ‘parallel’ dimension would be where the chain of events went in direction TWO. The pencil has been put into my pocket. …

Now imagine that there is an endless amount of ZERO points, maybe at 12:00 o’clock and one second, or at 12:00 o’clock and two seconds – each from which time can take any possible and probably impossible direction. …

And whatever direction a chain of events takes, there will always be an infinite amount of points in time from which new events can take completely different directions, creating completely different dimensions of time. …
Now you might have a better picture of the infinity of dimensions.

Most are remarkably reluctant though to pass any knowledge that could give another one an edge or help someone to surpass him. …
Those, the randomness of our results and the danger of some of our inventions, keep the other dwarfs from accepting us.

Shush! Don't speak that name aloud. It might call him here.
Sorry, I think we are out of stock.
The good news are: I got not killed by some drunken barbarian or unskilled axe thrower. The bad news are: I am still stranded here.
My offers are weapons, ammunition, armors, helmets, legs, and shields. If you'd like to see my offers, ask me for a {trade}.
Oh sweet Carlin, when will I see you again?
Edron is in the other end of the world. I wish I were there.
Port Hope and its cannibal orcs is almost as bad as Svargrond.
Even Thais could not be worse than this frozen hell hole here.
Jessica says they have agents everywhere. I wonder if they try to kill me to hinder our trade here ...
Since the day I spoke with Jessica, I sleep under my bed, just to be on the safe side.
Sure it looks peaceful, but to be honest, those wild barbarians are scary.
You know, I thought dwarfs were rude drunkards. However, that was before I met the people here.
Elves are strange creatures. I heard each of them can cast spells and curses. Every time an elf is looking in my direction, it gives me shivers.
For all I heard, the palisades won't stop them when they come at night to kidnap sleeping people and to eat them alive.
Yetis are huge, but perfectly camouflaged in the snow. They attack out of nowhere and before you can scream you are dead.
I don't know what you mean.
The local jarl is a fine man, measured by local standards that is. Still he can't bring me back from the dead when some of the barbarians go berserk and kill me.
The raiders are even wilder and, well ... more barbaric than the local barbarians. Can you imagine?!
The mines are lost. If only the people in Carlin were to accept that and call us back.
That is some spirit the barbarians seem to fear.
It's a haunted isle where the shamans call spirits and such to our world.
If those sea serpents had not vanished, I could still sit in the warm and safe Carlin. Cursed serpents.
Oh, don't even ask.

Have you talked to Thorwulf yet?? Be careful, I heard that he killed an experienced fighter in one hit just because he was called a coward after rejecting a challenge. I myself don't even dare to look in his eyes.
Good bye, Player.

conversation.A Restless Soul: Ahhhh! At last someone that can listen to my story!
I was captured and tortured to death by the cultists here. They worship a being that they call Ghazbaran …
In his name they have claimed the mines and started to melt the ice to free an army of vile demons that have been frozen here for ages …
Their plan is to create a new demon army for their master to conquer the world. Hjaern and the other shamans must learn about it! Hurry before it’s too late.

conversation.Iyad: Finally! A c…c…customer! Wh… where do you want to f…f…fly?
I’m a licensed c…carpet pilot. I can transport you t…to a warm p…place.
I t…transport travellers to the continent of Darama for a small fee. It’s w…warm there.
I can fly you to Darashia, to Edron, to Kazordoon, to Z… Zao, to the F…Femor Hills or to Issavi if you like. W….Where do you want to go?
I’m k…known as Iyad Ibn Abdul.
The thought of s…some mad sorcerer unleashing some f…fire magic is very tempting.
S…so close and s…still that far away.
For all its m…mistakes, Thais is warm at least.
I can fly you to Darashia, to Edron, to Kazordoon, to the F…Femor Hills or to Issavi if you like. W….Where do you want to go?
I would t…trade it for some firewood.
This h…here is no continent. This is h…hell.
Even D…Drefia can’t be worse than this land.
I d…don’t care about any n…news unless it’s the announcement of a h….heatwave.
Th…there, in case you have earmuffs, I pay w…well!
Do you really have earmuffs f…for me?? If so, just ask me for a trade!
D…Daraman’s blessings… oh, how I m…miss my warm Darashia…

conversation.Romir: Greetings, traveller. I’m a magical trader and trainer for sorcerer spells. How may I help you?
Banor is revered by many knights.
The barbarians are a bit rough, but most of them are honest and trustworthy people.
I would not be too surprised if that ancient race were found in some deep cave, even here in the North.
I am fine, thank you.
South of here, the raiders have at least three more or less steady camps.
Carlin is probably more tolerable than Thais but I am no friend of cities in general.
The chakoyas are of a malicious intelligence which is quite similar to humans’. Only the fact that they still rely on instinctive behaviour patterns keeps them somewhat at bay.
The barbarians see the icy north wind as an own entity. I think they might be right about that.
There something sinister going on and I am quite sure this cult you just mentioned is somehow connected to it.
The druids have more in common with the shamans than they might believe.
The local shamans are as powerful as some of the druids of Carlin, perhaps even more powerful. Their magic is strangely related to each other and their main difference is their philosophy.
Dwarfs are quite settled. Even if the mines were recaptured, I doubt that we would see more than a handful of dwarfs here.
The elves have no business at all over here.
I am not interesting enough for possible enemies.
It’s a place for the afterlife. Who can tell if the barbarians are not right about this?
There is no legend that connects excalibug with the north. I suggest to continue your search somewhere else.
One has to admit the power he accumulated is awesome and he even left mortality behind.
The eyes of the gods certainly rest even on this icy place.
The title of the jarl is currently held by Sven the Younger. He is the spokesperson of his people in times of peace and a kind of chieftain in times of war.
There is some kind of test you can take to become an honourary barbarian. Talk to Sven the Younger about that issue.
Not even the king’s arm reaches this remote place.
I doubt the queen even knows that this place exists.
All this hassle about these mines seems so stupid. As if this had been the only place with ore in the world.
My spells keep most monsters at bay. Not that many would come close to Svargrond anyway.
I am known as Romir.
If I cared about news, I hadn’t chosen this remote spot to settle down.
That’s the place where the shamans meet. It’s some kind of spiritual centre of the shaman community.
Such far away places are of little importance here.
I prefer loneliness over the busy hassle in a city. I guess that’s why they call us hermits after all.
The raiders are lead by a ruthless witch. That makes them even more dangerous.

That woman is a powerful spell caster. She rules with an iron hand. Her tactics are intimidation and agitation. It’s only a question of time that she is going to wage a rigorous attack on Svargrond, driven by her greed.
I teach some spells and sell runes and potions.
Thais is a good example why people should become hermits.
Uman stands for a quite specified kind of magic. Not everyone will feel comfortable with it.
The forbidden knowledge Zathroth has to offer can surely be tempting.
Venore is so absorbed in mundane wealth that it is only a matter of time before it devours itself.
Ah yes. An odd occurrence. I am quite convinced some strong magic was involved but I have no idea how or why.
The most yetis have been seen further south. Of course only because they are much more easily overlooked in the rugged mountains and huge snow plains here.

I guess one could call me a hermit. I am a bit new to this hermit business though and I have to admit I enjoy some company now and then. I also earn some money by teaching spells to those in search of knowledge.
Sorry, I don’t teach spells for your vocation.
I’m selling spirit, health and mana potions, runes, wands, rods and spellbooks. If you’d like to see my offers, ask me for a trade. If you want me to teach you, ask me about spells.
We offer health, spirit and mana potions in up to four sizes: normal, strong, great and ultimate. Ask me for a trade to see my offers.

conversation.Note: Transcription made after completing the Barbarian Test Quest

conversation.Sven: Be greeted, Player! What brings you here?
We don’t have an army and we don’t need one. Even if the raiders call us weak, everyone of us knows how to fight. …
All adults serve as guards for some days each month as a service for the community.
He’s a warrior god as far as I understood it. Well, in the end you have to fight your battles by yourself and not some mystic entity.
A true barbarian is something special among our people. Everyone who wants to become a barbarian will have to pass the barbarian test.
There are no such creatures on these isles and I doubt they even exist. I mean come on, floating blobs with numerous eyes, sounds like a fairy tale to me.
There is something in the air that worries me. A great evil is threatening all of us. …
I might not have the gift of dreams that foresee the future like my mother did, but I seem to have inherited some of her gift nonetheless. Sometimes I just feel that something is about to happen. …
And this time it’s something sinister and evil that threatens us all.
The raiders’ camps are mainly located in the south-western part of the isle. The camps are named after the major clans of the raiders: Ragnir, Bittermor and Grimhorn.
We are friends of the Carliners. Still we don’t allow their politics to influence our way to handle things here.
The chakoyas are neither beast nor man. Yet, they share the worst and more dangerous traits of both of them. Their small and furry appearance can be very misleading at first glance. …
But as soon as you’ve seen a pack of chakoyas literally shredding a mammoth into pieces with their claws and teeth, all misconceptions will be gone.
Father north wind is called Chyll by our people. He is an unforgiving hunter. He knows no mercy with the weak. …
Chyll is a harsh god and the best you can do is to avoid his attention. Only the shamans and druids deal with him.
Our people lived as nomads some generations ago. The contact with Carlin taught us another way of living. …
We did not like everything about it but we are not stupid. We have seen the many advantages. …
If you cannot adapt to this land, you are dead and so we adapted to it and built this city. When the contact to Carlin got lost during the years of the serpents, we kept this city alive. …
And we survived, even though the raiders did their best to make us fail.
I don’t care what people who come here believe in. If they provoke father Chyll, he will take care of them on his own. If their gods prove to be more powerful than Chyll, they might deserve to live.

Most shaman and druids of our people live on the sacred isle Nibelor. There, they divine the future, calm the wrath of father Chyll and prepare the dead for their last travel to the lands of Everspring.

I met some of those little people in the past. Considering our experience with the chakoyas, we don’t underestimate someone just for its look. And those dwarfs proved indeed to be powerful, courageous and enduring.
Some time ago, a few elves came here but they could not stand the cold and so they left pretty soon. Most likely it was Nibelor in which they have been interested.

Our enemies are numerous. Those of our people that we call the raiders are full of hate towards us. Then there are the voracious chakoyas that leave their icy homes to kill and slaughter from time to time …
Sometimes, the great ice dragons find their way here to wreak havoc, and there are many more hungry beasts of all kinds.
Everspring is the realm of the dead. It is a place of peace and harmony where those who boldly braved the challenges of life dwell for eternity and share stories at the campfires after a hunt. …
Every true barbarian that is properly brought into afterlife will join the great hunt in Everspring where the animals are fat and have the thickest furs.
On the campfire, there are numerous tales about this weapon. It’s told that it has been missing since ages …
In my opinion, the power and fame of a weapon shouldn’t exceed the power and fame of it’s wielder. And I have not heard of any hero whose fame would surpass that of excalibug.
Even here we heard about this powerful man. Travellers from the south only dare to whisper his name.
We know of father Chyll and his freezing breath. We care little for other gods. It is foolish to meddle with beings that are so powerful. …
We leave it to the druids and shamans to handle such affairs.
I am the jarl of my people. It’s an honour and I am very proud of it.
The dragons on our isles have adapted to the climate as every creature here. Instead of being aligned to fire, they became creatures of the cold. …
They are fierce and dangerous but, luckily, they only prey on beasts of the sea or those that wander the ice near their lairs.
I am more than just the spokesman and highest judge among my people. I don’t raise taxes, and when the clans feel that it is necessary, I will be replaced by another jarl.
You might become an honorary barbarian if you manage to pass the barbarian test.
We don’t need any kings and queens here. Being the jarl of my people, I see that the laws are followed.
A long time ago when the trade with Carlin was flourishing, people actually worked in the mines. …
During the years of the serpents, the mines had been abandoned. Later, the raiders took shelter there, although they blame us for living in a fortified city. …
Now, the traders of Carlin are back but some other foreigners seem to have claimed the mines from the raiders. …

It’s neither our business nor would we have the manpower to help them to recapture the mines. Also, if they do not have the strength to get the mines back on their own, they don’t deserve them anyway.
There are many dangerous creatures that roam our isles. But having seen what men can do to each other, I wouldn’t call any of them a monster.
My mother was that what my people call a witch. That is someone who has special magical abilities without any training on Nibelor. …
She used her powers more instinctively to amplify her healing skills when herbs would not suffice. She also had the gift to foretell the future. …
At first, the druids of Nibelor scorned her, but later they accepted her for her abilities and good intentions.

I am Sven the Younger. My father, Sven the Elder has been missing in the ice waste since I was young. But unless one of our people is buried properly, we assume that he is still in the realm of the living. …
Therefore, I am still known as ‘the Younger’, even though I have grown old.
There is something evil going on. I have it in my bones.
Nibelor has always been a sacred place for our people. The druids and shamans live there.
Our people are simple and honest. We don’t like the scheming ways of the city dwellers that live on the main continent.
We have heard only little about this far away place.
In the past, all barbarian tribes roamed the lands of Chyll as nomads. When the Carliners came here and the trade flourished, we used the resources to build this permanent settlement. …
Some of our people claimed that it was wrong to settle down and to abandon the ancient ways. A female shaman rose in the ranks of those who opposed the erection of a settlement. …
She gathered all those who were not content, who did not want any foreign influence and who refused to learn. …
They tried to destroy everything our ancestors had built, but with the help of the Carliners they were stopped and driven away. Now they still roam the land and attack everyone they see. …
They became the raiders, our worst enemy. Nowadays, there are three larger tribes that often build camps in the South of our land. …
And after all those years, surviving several generations, this female shaman is still their leader.
It’s an old tale but it persists in the minds of the Svargrondar. It is about my father. There are rumours that he is still alive. …

People regularly report about seeing him on top of the cliff right next to Svargrond. I myself would be glad if finally his corpse were found. Then I would be jarl ‘Sven the Elder’ ….. sounds much better.
We heard that this mythical dwarf lives somewhere on the southern Ice Islands.
I don’t sell anything. If the people accept you, they might be willing to trade with you.
You have braved all three tests and are now an honorary barbarian.
We understand that our friends from Carlin are wary with the realm ruled by Thais but this is not of our concern.
It’s some light side of mythical powers. Such things should only be dealt with by druids or shamans.
We did not allow them to stay here. This had nothing to do with our friendship with Carlin but for the way they handled things and their harmful approach to go hunting.
For more than two generations no ship had reached our shores because the giant sea serpents attacked and sank most ships that tried to travel here. …
Not long ago the sea serpents disappeared as suddenly as they had come. Now ships visit us again on a regular base.

The yetis are mythical beasts. Only few that encountered those creatures lived to tell the tale. The chakoyas worship them as divine beings, although they have no real relations to them as far as we can tell.
May wind and weather be with you, Player.

conversation.Eirik: LONG LIVE JARL SVEN, THE YOUNGER!
I AM A BARBARIAN! Names are of no concern during work!! If somebody is calling for help, I will come.
It's my duty to protect Svargrond and its citizens.
The shamans still have something to do for you. You should go to Nibelor and talk to them if you haven't been there for a while.
It's a sacred place for us! Our shamans live there. Ask Iskan if you want to go there.
He is the leader of the dog sled. Last time I saw him he was with his dogs on the shelf ice north of the harbour.
West of Svargrond is the Fimbul Ice Shelf, Nibelor and Grimlund are embedded in shelf ice, and in the north of Hrodmir are several small shelf ice fields.
Fimbul Shelf is the name of the big shelf ice west of Svargrond. A good spot to go ice fishing.
Stay away from there! It's the home of the chakoyas.
This big, icy rock you're standing at right now. The raiders live in the middle and south of the big Formorgar Glacier.
You can ask Iskan to bring you with his dog sled to Nibelor.
I heard Nelly talking about runes and fluids. Ask her.
That is a little too general. For what kind of profession do you need spells?
You have to look for Hjaern.
You have to look for Romir.
You have to look for Thorwulf.
You have to look for Hawkyr.
Svargrond is the only city here. Do you want to know where to find a shop,a trainer for a profession or a guildhall?
Near the harbour you find the equipment shop, the branch of the explorer's society as well as the post office and the bank. ...
Right-hand of the depot, which is in the centre of Svargrond, you find the furniture store ...
All weapon and armor traders linger at the arena in the North and the tavern is to the west.
Wait, wait! Don't say a word, it's, it's ...
that very small guy with the hairy feet? No?
I would love to have that legendary weapon. If you find it, bring it to me!
I am busy. Please ask the citizens for news.
MAY YOUR WEAPON ALWAYS BE SHARP!

conversation.Kjesse: May the spirits be with you, Player!
There is nothing wrong with seeking the shelter of a city but we have to be careful not to lose our connection with the spirits.
Speak to the outsiders who live here to learn about them and their cities.
That is just another far away place of no concern to us.
Only the harsh nature of the land keeps the chakoyas at the bay. If they would grow in numbers, they would surely annihilate all life here.
Knowing the chakoya, we know better than to underestimate the small ones.
At least those creatures seem more in touch with nature then other outsiders.
The mines are lost territory. It's the problem of the people from Carlin though.
The yeti does exist.
This is not of our concern.
In our old language it means as much as 'the true people'. I understand that the word has a slightly different meaning in other languages.

There are five different blessings available in five sacred places. These blessings are: the spiritual shielding, the spark of the phoenix, the embrace of Tibia, the fire of the suns and the wisdom of solitude.
I can sense you already talked to the hermit Eremo on the isle of Cormaya and recieved this blessing.
It was not natural for the sea serpents to behave that way. As suddenly as this behaviour started, as suddenly it ended. Nature got its way in the end.
The jarl oversees all affairs of common interest. We shamans oversee the spiritual affairs.
They enjoy violence and destruction. They are so wrong on their misguided way. That's all Yakchal's fault. She poisoned their minds with false ideas. She's a disgrace for all shamans.
Even though we call ourself shamans, our doctrines and our magic are quite similar to those of the druids.
That's the name of the spirit essence of the north wind.
The isle of Nibelor has been the centre of our shamanistic forefathers in ancient times.
I am Kjesse.
I am a shaman.
Your mission should be to become one with nature. That is maybe the only way to bear Chyll's icy breath.
Our jarl is more of a spokesperson. We don't know any kings or queens here.
Our jarl is more of a spokesperson. We don't know any kings or queens here.
Our believes are different from those of the outsiders. Ask on Nibelor to learn more about our believes.
He must be driven by the darkest spirits.
It's only an outsider's tale.
I am not overly interested in the affairs of men.
I have nothing to sell but I can tell you where to go if you want to get a blessing.
I am fine.
It's rather a wisdom than a rumour I want to give you on your way. When you feel Chyll in your heart and you have no fear anymore, your way to Everspring will be flattened.
May the spirits guide your way, Player.

conversation.Jessica: Greetings stranger. Let me know if you want to trade gems or jewellery. I am also the local bank contact.
My name is Jessica.
I sell jewellery and serve as the local bank contact.
Currently you can purchase Wedding Rings, Golden Amulets, and Ruby Necklaces. We also buy Gold Ingots.
We can change money for you. You can also access your bank account.
Okay okay, no need to be rude! It seems you are already know everything.
We can change money for you. You can also access your bank account.
Renting a house has never been this easy. Simply make a bid for an auction. We will check immediately if you have enough money ...

Please keep in mind that the sum you have used to bid will be unavailable unless somebody places a higher bid. Once you have acquired a house the rent will be charged automatically from your bank account every month.
I don't have anything to do for you.
The king in Thais works for the Venorean trade barons. I can't imagine what sinister ideas they might implant into his mind right now.
The gods only help those who help themselves.
We had hardly any assistance from the druids here. I think that's more than suspicious ...
There might be some agent from Venore who has been infiltrated into their ranks. It is also possible that these treehuggers were bribed with a handful of acorns. Who knows!
There are enough heroes around to take care of those obvious threats.
All Thaian colonies are in the firm grip of the schemes of Venorean trade barons.
This wannabe city full of hardly civilised barbarians is a dangerous mixture. It takes little for the Venorean agents to cause havoc here.
The trade barons are the worst enemies one can have. They have their hidden agents everywhere and murder and treachery are natural to them.
There is a mine but no dwarfs. What do they know what we don't, I ask you? I am convinced they know that Venore will make anyone suffer that is trying to claim these mines.
The elves are not interested in our problems at all.
We have never ever seen one here. Instead of talking about far-off chakoyas, they should concentrate on REAL threats like the Venoreans.
There are no yetis. That's just another story to draw off our attention from what is really happening.
Spare me with that cult stories. This was no cult but some Venorean agents who were heading to their hired barbarians which had occupied our mines.
We don't trade with them.
The local chieftain does nothing to help us. It would be so easy for him to drive those other barbarians away from the mines. I suspect he was bribed to remain inactive by agents of Venore.
Those are simple people. Sadly, they have been influenced by others.
How convenient for Venore that we lost control over the mines. And isn't it also convenient for Venore that Carlin seems to lack interest to recapture the mines. I'd say that smells like conspiracy.
I can't say that I trust these fellows.
That belongs to some superstitious belief of the locals.
Some mysterious isle which was hardly seen by any outsider. I wonder what's happening there in all that secrecy.

The sea serpents were surely the work of Venore. They are the only ones that are unscrupulous enough to execute such a plan. Their disappearance was just part of some conspiracy to lure us here for some reason ...
I am only wondering how the Venoreans managed to lure that many serpents to the north.
I am fine. Odd that you ask though ... I hope you are not up to something.
There are no news. I think that's quite suspicious.
I heard the jarl opened a head hunt on the Venorans. As this is a secret, you have to use the keyword “blubber” to gain his trust in that case. He promised 1000 gold for every dead Venorean hunter.
Good bye.

conversation.Hawkyr: Hello fellow hunter. Are you looking for paladin spells? I'm your man.
I am Hawkyr the hunter.
I am a hunter and bowyer. If you need some training, I am the man you want to see.
Sorry, I don't have anything to do for you.
In our lands, the most successful hunter is the king. Be it beast or man.
In our lands, the most successful huntress is the queen. Be it beast or woman.
The gods of the south seem to have little influence here.
Sorry, I don't teach spells for your vocation.
They know the ways of spirits and nature. You can learn a lot from them just by listening. Still, you can always learn a lot if you're listening well to what nature tells you.
Better ask the Southerners about that one.
A weapon hardly useful for a hunter.
The wolves are very hungry lately.
I don't think I'd like that place and it's not only that this is not my marked territory.
Only foreigners talk about that place now and then.
I admire the safety of the burrow and the closeness of the pack. It's a good thing to have a lair to which you can withdraw to lick your wounds.
Thais is some far away city.
Carlin and Venore seem to live in some sort of rivalry.
Most dwarfs I've seen seem to lack the stealthiness to become a good hunter.
Elves are good hunters. Even I was able to learn something from the elves that came here. I am thinking about visiting their city some day.
The chakoya are ferocious hunters. They don't only kill out of hunger, they love the carnage they are causing.
Yetis are rare but they do exist. Everyone that has been hunting in the frozen wastes for some time can share stories of their sightings.
It's not easy to hunt dragons. Suddenly, a hunter might become the hunted in their lairs.

conversation.Lurik: Welcome to the explorer society headquarter of Svargrond, Player!
My name is Lurik. Odd enough you ask though. People hardly do that nowadays. I feel as if my name was painted above my head or something.
I am the explorer's society. I just love it to be at the frontier of all known lands.
No kings or queens rule these remote lands.
We know of father Chyll and his freezing breath. We care little for other gods. It is foolish to meddle with beings that are so powerful ...
We leave it to the druids and shamans to handle such affairs.
Even here we heard about this powerful man. Travellers from the south only dare to whisper his name.
On the campfire, there are numerous tales about this weapon. It's told that it has been missing since ages ...
In my opinion, the power and fame of a weapon shouldn't exceed the power and fame of it's wielder. And I have not heard of any hero whose fame would surpass that of excalibug.
At this remote spot, news are old news. Did you hear that quara attacked Liberty Bay?
I am fine. Thank you. There is a bit less work here than I had expected but I am sure we will have some intriguing discoveries just waiting for us.

I met some of those little people in the past. Considering our experience with the chakoyas, we don't underestimate someone just for its look. And those dwarfs proved indeed to be powerful, courageous and enduring.
Some time ago, a few elves came here but they could not stand the cold and so they left pretty soon. Most likely it was Nibelor in which they have been interested.

Maybe you already heard that we send our dead with a boat on their last journey. A rumour came to my ear that many of the corpses stranded on the small island of Helheim where they walk around as UNDEADS. I wonder if this is true.
Our noble society is dedicated to explore the unknown. No location is too remote for our members to travel there ...
No beast is too wild to be hunted. No treasure buried too deep to be unearthed ...
Only the most dedicated and fearless adventurers may join our ranks.
But you are already a member, Player.
You are a novice of the explorer's society.
You have no special badge earned yet.
Sorry, I have no mission available.

This city has seen much in the few days of its existence. At first it was a little trading spot where ships form Carlin landed. Later it became a deposit for ore that has been mined in the mountains ...
Then local people joined the traders from Carlin and supplied them with fish, furs and meat ...
Soon it became a small settlement and the locals, fascinated with the abundance of wood the traders brought with them, begun to build houses ...
It became a centre of conflict when some barbarians decided it was wrong to settle in a town and later on struggled to survive when the contact to Carlin was lost for decades ...
Today, the city got a little boost by the presence of foreigners here. But only the future will tell what the fate of this city will be.

Most shaman and druids of our people live on the sacred isle Nibelor. There, they divine the future, calm the wrath of father Chyll and prepare the dead for their last travel to the lands of Everspring.
Nibelor has always been a sacred place for our people. The druids and shamans live there.
Everspring is the realm of the dead. It is a place of peace and harmony where those who boldly braved the challenges of life dwell for eternity and share stories at the campfires after a hunt ...
Every true barbarian that is properly brought into afterlife will join the great hunt in Everspring where the animals are fat and have the thickest furs.
I don't care what people who come here believe in. If they provoke father Chyll, he will take care of them on his own. If their gods prove to be more powerful than Chyll, they might deserve to live.
The jarl is a kind of chieftain of the local people here. If you haven't done yet, talk to him. If you want to be accepted by the people here, you will have to ask the jarl for the barbarian test.
A true barbarian is something special among our people. Everyone who wants to become a barbarian will have to pass the barbarian test.

All of our juveniles have to take the barbarian test to become a true member of our community. Foreigners who manage to master the test might become honorary barbarians and gain the respect of our people.
The people here seem to be a bit uncivilised on the first glance. Rest rest assured that they are hospitable and generous if you earn their respect in some way.
Those barbarian who did oppose the building of this settlements call themselves raiders. They consist of some major and minor clans. ...
It's said that they are lead by a shaman woman, who has celebrated her 100th birthday a long time ago, but I am not sure how believable such records are.
A long time ago when the trade with Carlin was flourishing, people actually worked in the mines. During the years of the serpents, the mines had been abandoned. ...
Later, the raiders took shelter there, although they blame us for living in a fortified city ...
Now, the traders of Carlin are back but some other foreigners seem to have claimed the mines from the raiders ...

It's neither our business nor would we have the manpower to help them to recapture the mines. Also, if they do not have the strength to get the mines back on their own, they don't deserve them anyway.
It was an astonishing phenomenon. For decades, sea serpents made it impossible to reach these northern isles by ship ...

However, almost over night the sea serpents seemed to be gone and the contact between Carlin and the isles here could finally be reestablished.

conversation.Halvar: I have no time to talk and you should FIGHT instead of wasting your time here!

It would be better not to die! In every pit there is an emergency exit to the south. If you die in a pit... well... your corpse and backpack are gone, so enter at your own risk.
Like I said: Everything is allowed. Go in, kill monsters and try not to get killed by your own.
You can use whatever you want but be aware that you might lose items and your backpack if you die.
What do you want to know? Something about the three different difficulties, the general rules or the prices? Maybe you also want to know what happens when you die?
The fee depends on the difficulty you choose. If you are a Greenhorn you have to pay 1000 gold, as a Scrapper you have to pay 5000 gold and as a Warlord the participation fee is 10000 gold. ...
Each competitor who manages to win all ten pits will win the arena goblet and an unique item appropriate to your difficulty level.
First you pay me the participation fee according to the difficulty you choose. This will grant you access to the door near me. ...
In the next room there you will find three teleporters. They all lead to the first pit, which you can enter as soon as there is no battle going on there anymore. ...
Beware though - when you enter the pit there is no turning back and the fight will start immediately! ...
Should you notice that you have overestimated your abilities, you can run for your life and flee through the teleporter to the south of the pit. ...
However, no real barbarian would run from a fight, right? When you successfully killed your opponent, a teleporter will appear to the west that brings you to the next pit. ...
If there is still a fight going on in the pit you would proceed to, there will be a red shrine stone placed instead. ...
As soon as the warrior in the next pit leaves the area, the red shrine stone will change into a teleporter. ...
However if that warrior died, you have to walk in front of the red shrine stone to create a teleporter. ...

There is a time limit of six to seven minutes to finish each pit. When the flame of life in the upper left corner is starting to wane, you have exactly one minute left to proceed to the next room. ...
If you take longer to kill the monster and leave the room you will be kicked out dishonourably.
There are three difficulties: Greenhorn, Scrapper and Warlord. On each challenge you will be confronted with ten monsters increasing in strength. ...
Besides the glory and honour you will earn we have unique awards for those who manage to pass the arena completely.
Only the strongest among us will take this challenge. The fee is 10000 gold. If you pass that I promise you the respect of all citizens here. You will be a hero!
The most common difficulty for us. The fee is 5000 gold. So if you are experienced in fighting middle class monsters this is your challenge!
That is the easiest way in our arena. The fee is 1000 gold. We were setting this up for of our children to challenge some easy monsters and train them for the future.

Better run away than risk to die. You’ll lose experience and skill points each time you die.

You can found a party with your friends by right-clicking on a player and selecting ‘Invite to Party’. If you are invited to a party, right-click on yourself and select ‘Join Party’.

Only found parties with people you trust. You can attack people in your party without getting a skull. This is helpful for training your skills, but can be abused to kill people without having to fear negative consequences.
The leader of a party has the option to distribute gathered experience among all players in the party. If you are the leader, right-click on yourself and select ‘Enable Shared Experience’.
