conversation.Gnomad: Hi there! I'm ready to brief you with tactical advice.

You will encounter quite a lot of beasties in the area ahead of us. The end of the cave-system is where the trouble begins though. The monsters here all serve some massive creature only known as Deathstrike. ...

The creature is hidden in a well protected chamber. The good news is, we've managed to erect a crystal structure close to the cave that is able to breach its defence and teleport someone into the chamber. ...

The bad new is that the crystals need a specific charge before they can work. As soon as the crystals begin to charge up, Deathstrikes' minions will frenzy and spawn in waves to crush all opposition. ...

You will have to kill them quite fast, to not be overwhelmed by their numbers! Our own tries to breach the defence has proven that you'll have to endure six waves until the teleporter to Deathtstrikes' cave opens for a short 30 seconds. ...
Use the GREEN command crystal in the cave to begin the charging of the teleport! Good luck.
I'm the gnomish tactical advisor for this area!
Ah you are amazed by our crystals, aren't you? Well, you have only seen a tiny fraction of what they are able to do.
In the last century mushrooms have become more and more important for producing raw materials and tools and less important for sustenance.
We gnomes are masters of growing and working crystals and we also mastered the raising of a variety of mushrooms for different purposes.

conversation.Wally: Be greeted, traveller.
I am working here at the post office for Kevin.
Oh, our boss is upstairs. Better only disturb him with important issues though.
Ask Mr. Postner about your current missions.
I'm Wally the post officer.
Yes, thats me, Wally!
Elven volunteers for becoming a postofficer are quite rare. We had to rely on a human living there to ensure our postsystems function. Most elvish members of the guild prefer to work as courriers.
I gues Edron isn't the source of wealth and rescources as the thaians hoped. The defection of those knights did cause the expansion and exploitation there to an halt.
The city of the dwarfs is a bit hidden and new postoficers often get lost while looking for it. Just look for a hidden passage to a western valley in the mountaion called the big old one.
Its a huge Mountain, north of here, just across the river.
One of the oldest holdings of humanity that still exist and the heart of the biggest kingdom in the known world.
I think no longer is king Tibianus reigning this city, nor are the merchants ruling it, regardless what they might think. The true monarch before whom all there bow is the money.
If I would be looking for bones I'd inspect some skeletons ... If I weren't so affraid of them that is.
This minotaur is quite moody. Better make sure not to anger him. He's likely to call for his guards as soon as he notices a stranger, so you are on tough luck if you ever find him.
This dog is his majestys most priced possesion and heavily guarded. Anger the dog and you anger the king.
Old Ben lost some of his marbles in some battle long ago. He is still a quite capable postman though ... on second thought thats some disturbing fact.
Dove is as good as a dozend pigeons. He He He.
Although I never met her in person we became penpals over the time.
Dwarfs make quite good postmen. They are stubborn, strong and ... sturdy. Its a waste that he prefers a job behind the counter.

This Olrik was made postman only for convenience. He is quite aware that his attitude and affiliation with the thaian government makes it impossible for him to rise in rank. This leads only to him behaving even worse tough.
It was a pleasure to help you.

conversation.Dwarf Deep Guard: I’m busy here. If you need something, go to Gnomus, Klom Stonecutter or Lardoc for more information.

conversation.Sigurd: Welcome to the magic store, Zaajebustor! Ask me for a trade if you need something.
Of course, just browse through my wares. Or do you want to look only at potions, wands or runes?
Have a look! You can also look at potions or runes.
I’m Sigurd Fireworker, brother to Etzel Fireworker, son of Fire of the Molten Rocks.
I help my brother handling his little magic store so he can focus on studying spells.

conversation.Player: Animate dead rune / energy bomb rune / poison bomb rune

conversation.Sigurd: Sorry, but runes of this type can’t be purchased here.
Wands can be wielded by sorcerers only and have a certain level requirement. There are eight different wands, would you like to hear about them?
I’m selling spirit, health and mana potions, runes, wands, rods and spellbooks. If you’d like to see all of my offers, ask me for a trade.
Maybe another time.
I can offer you fire bomb runes.
Sorry, we removed the old life and mana fluids from our assortment. However, we offer health, spirit and mana potions in up to four sizes, just ask me for a trade.
In case you’d like a free snakebite rod, just ask me for one. Or would you like to hear about rods in general?
Go ask my brother.
We offer health, spirit and mana potions in up to four sizes: normal, strong, great and ultimate. Ask me for a trade to see my offers.
I’m selling spirit, health and mana potions, runes, wands, rods and spellbooks. If you’d like to see all of my offers, ask me for a trade.
It’s 3:32 am right now.
Well, you could ask me for a trade to deposit your flasks, but you can also do it old style. I will pay you 5 gold for every empty vial and potion flask. Ok?
Hmm, but please keep Tibia litter free.
Yes, those runes are in my assortment. Ask me for a trade to have a look.
Good bye. Come back soon.

conversation.Isimov: Hiho Player and greetings kid! What brings you here?
I’m the master of the Hall of the Ancients.
The burial chamber of our ancestors. All firstborn of our race are there .. all but Durin.
Ah yes, the first born. He became a higher entity to protect us. His mortal remains were buried at a remote spot.
My name is Isimov Dustbearer, son of Fire and Earth from the Molten Rock.
I can see you received the blessing of the two suns in the suntower near Ab’Dendriel.
Gives us food and shelter, quite useful isn’t it?
The last haven for dwarfs. Our last hope for survival.
Etzel, good old Etzel. I was his teacher long time ago. Now he’s running a guild … they grow so fast … so fast, jawoll.
A world of dangers, a world of wonders.
I think it’s the fourth age of the yellow flame, isn’t it?
You are too young for quests, jawoll.
Keep your adventurer’s stone well.
The gods abandoned us, we abandoned the gods. That’s it, no big deal I tell ya, jawoll.
I’ve seen many of his type come and go. He will fall and somebody else will take his place.
The emperor resides far above us in the upper caves. Sometimes I wonder if it’s a good idea that the emperor is that far away from the temple.
Life is easy to understand. First you are born, then you die. Simple stuff, even elves could grasp the concept.
<sighs> A bunch of kids playing war. May the elements help us.
This mountain is as old as the world. The first dwarfs were born here.
Greed for gold can blind your vision for important things.

There are five blessings available in five sacred places: the spiritual shielding, the spark of the phoenix, the embrace of Tibia, the fire of the suns and the wisdom of solitude. Additionally, you can receive the twist of fate here. …
You can become a citizen of Kazordoon through the power of our ancestors.

It is said that one enhanced blessing, the ‘heart of the mountain’, has been lost in the icy wastes of Svargrond. Find a nomad far to the west of these barren lands, hiding in the cold there, slightly above ground. …

It is also said that a mysterious djinn, bound to an existence of slavery, lies buried somewhere beneath the northern Tiquanda jungle. I cannot confirm whether this tale is true but if you find him, you shall also find the ‘blood of the mountain’.
Go and buy some.
The life of a dwarf is an eternal struggle. It hardens us and makes us the fine race we are, jawoll.
They worship the elemental forces of the earth.
Are they still around? Well, give them one or two hundred years and they’ll be gone, jawoll.
You do not need any healing right now.
Never heard that word. What’s a gregor?
Isn’t that the kid that took over the Jolly Axeman tavern? Far too young for such a job, but did anyone ask me? No!
How could she marry this Jimbin? I mean, they are kids! Know nothing about life and stuff. Couldn’t they wait for at least a hundred years or so?
Bezil and Nezil are typical profiteers, they belong to a fine new breed of dwarfs we’ve raised, pah.
What a hasty fellow! Can’t be healthy to live in such a hurry, jawoll.
He has almost no beard, and he has already forgotten the traditions of his ancestors. Modern techniques… almost like one of these technomancers.
Could become a great warrior one day. Still needs to learn so much.
I’m not sure if I should tell you. After all, you are a human, and not a dwarf. Hmm, probably not. Sorry.
A young and greedy race, but somewhat noble. Sometimes, they remind me of orcs.
Don’t know much about this stuff. Find them in my soup sometimes.
They leave us alone, and we leave them alone.
Only another nuisance.
I must admit there have been worse generals in the years before, jawoll.
I don’t know anything new.
The greenskins are after everybody. Beware!
They worship the elemental forces of fire.
Just ask in which of the five blessings you are interested in.
You already received my line of the prayer.

The twist of fate will not reduce the death penalty like the other blessings, but instead prevent you from losing your other blessings as well as the amulet of loss, should you wear one. It costs the same as the other blessings. …
Would you like to receive that protection for a sacrifice of 50000 gold, child?
This is a special blessing I can bestow upon you once you have obtained at least one of the other blessings and which functions a bit differently. …
It only works when you’re killed by other adventurers, which means that at least forty percent of the damage leading to your death was caused by others, not by monsters or the environment. …
I see you received the spiritual shielding in the whiteflower temple south of Thais.
I can sense that the spark of the phoenix already was given to you by the dwarven priests of earth and fire in Kazordoon.
I can sense that the druids north of Carlin have provided you with the Embrace of Tibia.
I can see you received the blessing of the two suns in the suntower near Ab’Dendriel.
I can sense you already talked to the hermit Eremo on the isle of Cormaya and received this blessing.
Ahhh! When I was a little dwarf, I was on a quest to find it. I was digging up the complete ghostlands and now one thing is sure: It must be somewhere else, jawoll.
Take care, Player!

conversation.Lokur: How may I help you Player? Ask me for a trade if you want to buy something. I can also explain the mail system, sell tickets for the ore wagon service or give you access to your bank account.
Here. Don’t forget that you need to buy a label too if you want to send a parcel. Always write the name of the receiver in the first line and make sure you entered it correctly.
With our mail system you can send letters and parcels to other Tibians. I can either explain how letters and parcels work or sell them to you if you ask me for a trade.
If you want to buy a letter, ask me for a trade. Or do you want me to explain how letters work?

With a letter you can send a message to another Tibian’s depot. If you want to send it to ‘Ben’ in Thais, use the letter – so that a form opens – and write ‘Ben’ in the first line. Write your message below that. …
Then drag your letter on one of the blue mailboxes here to send it.

Each major city has at least one depot. Just step in front of one of the lockers and you can store items inside. Your mail will also arrive there. It doesn’t matter which depot you stored it in – you can retrieve all your items from any depot in any city!
If you want to buy a parcel, ask me for a trade. Or do you want me to explain how parcels work?
If you want to buy a label, ask me for a trade. Or do you want me to explain how labels work?
Well, you can always ask me for help if you need information.
I’m the royal post dwarf and I’m really proud of it. Lately I accepted the offer of running the Bank.
My name is Lokur Stampsmasher, son of Earth of the Dragoneaters.
Imagine, they have a post office there too, jawoll.
Our king has a treasure room and, so he doesn’t need a depot.
Too bad, I forgot my watch at home.
You can transfer money from your account to the account of a guild via player guild transfer. If you are a member of a guild, you can deposit money on its account via guild deposit. …
If you are leader or vice leader of a guild, you can also withdraw gold from your guild account via guild withdraw or use a guild transfer to transfer money from your guild to another guild. …
As a leader or vice leader of a guild you can also transfer money from your guild account to a player account via guild player transfer. …
Please keep in mind that we may need some time to process such requests.
Please tell me the amount of gold you would like to transfer.
I am sorry but it seems you are currently not in any guild.
You certainly have made a pretty penny. Your account balance is 0 gold.
It’s south of Kazordoon. Just follow that road, can’t miss it.
Ask Kroox about that stuff.

If you buy an item from the market, the required gold will be deducted from your bank account automatically. On the other hand, money you earn for selling items via the market will be added to your account. It’s easy!
It’s not big but I like the company.
Ah, this human is as persistent as a dwarf. A worthy leader indeed, jawoll.
Renting a house has never been this easy. Simply make a bid for an auction on the house section of the official Tibia website. We will check immediately if you have enough money …

Please keep in mind that the sum you have used to bid will be unavailable unless somebody places a higher bid. Once you have acquired a house the rent will be charged automatically from your bank account every month.
Your weekly ticket is still valid. Would be a waste of money to purchase a second one.
I only know the poem of the ancient tribe. I used to tell it to my son when he was a little boy. Wanna hear it?
Two tribes united in the land of the gods. …
They envied themselves and there was a fight. …
One tribe left against great odds, …
never to see the great citadel again, …
abandon their forges, their former home. …
All thoughts of homecoming have been in vain, …
Kazordoon was founded and ended their roam.

conversation.Malech: This is one of our defensive positions that we maintain to disrupt enemy movement, resupply our troops and have an eye on other problems.
The emperor is hard-pressed and has to take tough decisions each day. It is certainly not fun to be the emperor in these days.
The greatest threat in the tunnels are the patrols of the Lost. …

The renegades don’t have much manpower and resources to threaten Kazordoon again any time soon, but on the other hand this makes them quite dangerous for our patrols and outposts, as they are desperate for loot. …
Then there are the beasts of the depths. They can usually be found in certain pockets that they claim as their territory. …
And don’t forget about the old drilling rotworms that have become feral again and have given birth to new generations of rotworms already.

The renegades lack the strength, number and organisation to do anything but harass our troops and hinder the retaking of the mines. They desperately try to get some secret weapon to capture Kazordoon somehow. …

Without the manpower for an all-out assault, they are looking for other means of conquest. Another mushroom blight might be just what they need to weaken our protection. But they are certainly investigating other means. …

They would probably ally themselves with the Lost if the latter could be reasoned with. I guess even the renegades are smart enough to see what becomes of those who become thralls of the vile masters of the Lost. …
The ones that we capture are often drunk but starved, and still insist their buddy will avenge them with some kind of secret weapon.
Well, they look like dwarfs, but they fight like insane demons. Word is, they come from the depths of earth. They are a clan that dug so deep, that the heat has driven them mad.
The name is Malech Ironhead, son of earth, from the Dragon Eaters.
Our greatest fear, that the dreaded basilisk has found a way from his caves, might have come true. There are rumours about strange eggs that can be found in the caves. …
I really doubt that they are basilisk eggs, but the rumour persists. If you come across some strange egg at some remote place, better be safe than sorry, and destroy it.
They are the remnants of a rebellion against our emperor. I’m not a storyteller, ask someone else about the whole stuff. I’m here to fight them and not to talk about them, jawoll.
I don’t give anything about the illusions of drunk cowards.

conversation.Humgolf: Player, good day .. or night, whatever. What do you want?
Go away with that water-thing!
I’m not allowed to sell worms to people without a form 007 licence to drill or a 0815 artist licence.
It’s a special licence for artists. It was only used once as I sold a white worm to Frietsiek and Yor.
The worm does not care about gods, why should I?
Can’t say I like it much.
They should remember old dwarfish rotworm tactics. Think like a worm and the battle is almost won.
Always chatting. How can someone talk that much?
A true enemy of the worms.
The mountain seems tasty as far as it concerns my worms.
Do you want to buy a rotworm?
Hey, you don’t own a drilling licence. No deal!
You’ll regret that.
I can’t sell you rotworms without you having a drilling licence, but I buy meat, ham and fresh dead rats for my rotworms. Ask me for a trade if you have any.
Take a look at what I buy.
Gold is one of the things my worms can unearth.
Many noisy people down here are scaring my worms.
Never was up there to look at it.
Thinks she’s to good to talk to rotworm tamers.
If he’d live today he’d be a rotworm tamer like me.
Home of the worms, home of my people, too.
They are not worth to be mentioned.
The emperor should spend more money on rotworm husbandry.
If you own a good worm you need nothing else.
Does a worm need spells to work his kind of magic? I do neither.
Silly fairy tale.
Where earth is giving, fire is taking. That’s the way of the elements.
Bye, Player.
That guy is a monster! I despise rotworm killers.
They have an understanding of worms.
His tavern is too crowded and too bright for a dwarf with taste like me.
Don’t like the way she looks at my worms.
I am here to help the worms, not the fools.
They are not cute and not intelligent.
They are stupid and ugly.
Only a rotting plant is a good plant.
I’m the chief rotworm tamer of Kazordoon. I sell rotworms and buy meat, tentacle pieces and tasty fresh rats for my worms.
I like the mines best.
More nice beneath this noisy green surface.
Poor guy, has lost his drilling licence for drinking.
What by the worm are you talking about?
I’m Humgolf Molesight, Son of Earth, from the Molten Rock.
Who needs news if the old things are still good enough?
They are even more stupid and ugly than minotaurs.
Hotheads.
Time does not matter to a dwarf who understands the ways of the worm.
Too hard to be gnawed away by even the finest worm.
GO AWAY! I heard they think of replacing worms with machines. That is an OUTRAGE!
We are trading now and then. Fine dwarf he is.
They are so cute and so intelligent.

conversation.Lesser Messenger of Heaven: Be greeted mortal! Be on guard, dire times are at hand.
Malignant forces from beyond our world are rampaging through reality and threatening existence itself.
Forces beyond our comprehension are tearing on our world. It is their intention to unmake reality. What we see here is only a symptom of an illness that has befallen existence.

Everything you see and experience is only a small part of reality. Most of it is beyond your grasp and comprehension. The invisible and more fragile parts of reality are the ones that suffer most right now.
The boundaries have been weakened and destructive forces are pouring into our realm. The vortex that you see is only one of many and it is slowly weakening our world.
An unspeakable thing that was not meant to be and that lurked in a place that does not exist has been foolishly allowed into our world. ...
What you see here is only the fallout of its worming its way into existence and yet, the thing is that unfathomable that the process is tearing the world apart.
Each incursion is hurting the world, eating away its strength. But creation is strong and can heal and recover over time. ...
Yet you will have to weaken the incursions as much as you can to give the world the needed time to heal.
The vortex is actually a wound. The devouring nothing lies beyond. Only by destroying the minions from beyond and entering the vortex, the dreadful force behind it all might be stopped.
Healing takes time and strength. The lesser the damage caused by the incursions, the lesser time and strength is needed to heal. ...
Eventually, though, the world will succumb to its wounds unless the potency of the incursions can be weakened significantly.
Only by entering the Heart of Destruction and by challenging the devourer of the worlds, the incursions can be weakened. But that is for another to reveal.
It's not for me to discuss this.
It's not for me to discuss this.
The dreadful knowledge will taint your soul soon enough. For now, it is sufficient to say it is an enemy of life and existence.
This vortex is only a minor incursion. To truly challenge the powers from beyond, you'll have to enter a more threatening incursion. ...
Still, your help is valuable. We can't allow such incursion to occur without resistance. ...
By entering the vortex and slaying the creatures there, you'll reduce the toll it takes from reality.
Farewell!

conversation.Budrik: Hiho, hiho Player. Why do you disturb me?
I’m the foreman of this mine.
We understand the ways of the earth like nobody else.
I’m a miner, not your mother. Go ask someone else.
The hideout of the Horned Fox is probably a dangerous if not lethal place for inexperienced adventurers. It is the source of all the trouble around here.
He is a minotaur who was kicked out of Mintwallin. He must have some kind of hideout nearby.
This is not an amusement park! Leave the miners and their drilling-worms alone and get out! We’ve already got enough trouble without you.
Well, I could need help with that damn Horned Fox and his gang, but I guess since you are rather experienced, killing minotaurs would bore you to death. I’ll wait for someone else. But thanks!
We occasionally come across nasty beasts in the deepest mines.
My name is Budrik Deepdigger, Son of Earth, from the Molten Rock.
It was very decent of you to help me, and I am thankful, really I am, but now I have to get back to my duties as a foreman.
The Horned Fox is leading his bandits in sneak attacks and raids on us.
Yes, I remember him well. It was a tragedy. An earthquake led to a cave-in and many of our brave miners died. …
Their ghosts still haunt the Grothmok tunnel in which they died, so we had to seal it off.
Thank the rocks! I’m so glad to have this precious heirloom back!

Mining is more than just digging in the dirt. It is an art form, a philosophy, the gathered knowledge of generations!! We Deepdiggers, Sons of Earth, from the Molten Rock have taken the science of mining to a new level!

conversation.Shortsighted Dwarf: Hi <hiccups> there, mate. I don’t remember seeing your face here before. I guess your battle group has been rounded up by the imperialists and you have been sent here to join our group.
An incompetent fool like his predecessor <hiccups>. The latter even managed to have his beard stolen while sleeping, and had to resign because of that. …

It was a member of our fellowship who managed this coup, jawoll! Even then our people were daring and worked for a change. Sadly, this lesson did not sink into the hearts of dwarfenhood as intended. …

Or else much would have been better. A more enlightened leader and freedom for all would have prevented that stupid mushroom blight and much bloodshed. The emperor is personally responsible for the disasters in his reign. …
The rise of foreign adventurers, the suppression of the masses, the blight and he forced us first into a rebellion, and then into exile.
<hiccups> They are single-minded despots. We just wanted a chance to live a life in wealth and glory, as they did. But they denied us that. …

They followed ages old rules that never changed, in a society that never changed. We wanted respect <hiccups> and privileges that the elders claimed for themselves. And we wanted it now and not in hundred years or so. …
We had enough of being bullied around by ignorants, just because their age and station gave them the right to. We <hiccups> nearly succeeded in freeing dwarfenhood and leading them to a new dawn. …
The only thing that stopped us in the end was treason.
A true hero who has become a martyr for our cause and the dream to free dwarfenhood of oppression.
Bah, they are an even greater threat to us than the imperialists. They lack any fear and lust for blood. <hiccups> We usually try to avoid them. …
Our attempt to lure them into the lines of the imperialists have been <hiccups> not very successful yet, but the fights between our enemies opens up a great deal of new opportunities!
<lowers his voice> There is one thing that the imperialists have always feared: …

The basilisk! If we could get the beast to attack Kazordoon or even better, gain control over it, we could destroy the enemy forces once and for all. With the basilisk at our disposal, soon we would rule Kazordoon! …
In the worst case it would at least wreak havoc amongst our enemies. We can certainly contain it again later on … somehow. Our best geomancers are working on a plan right now, I tell you. …
You know those tiny runes that allow some magic users to become the master of a creature? Now imagine, all what it takes to enslave the basilisk is probably some gibber rune and more spellcasters. …
Soon, our days of dirt and hunger are over and we will rule over Kazordoon as we should!
Someone could not keep his mouth shut and the emperor <hiccups> got word of our plan. What should have been a clean, swift and deadly strike became a disaster. …

Our elite just ran into a trap and was mercilessly cut down with crossbow bolts without even the chance of a fair fight. We carried the combat to the city though, but too many of the other dwarfs were not ready to be freed from the oppression. …
They sided with the imperialists and we found ourselves outnumbered one to hundred. When we retreated to the mines, we had evened the numbers out a bit, jawoll! <hiccups> …

But still the blood toll was too high to continue the fight in the city. So we struck the imperialists where it hurt them most – in their gold coffers! We took some of their precious mines from them! …
And they are too afraid of us to retake them. Another sign of their weakness and incompetent leadership. They can’t handle a situation that is not covered by their strict rules. <hiccups>
Good <hiccups> bye, mate.

conversation.Dwarf Explorer: I’m busy here. If you need something, go to Gnomus, Klom Stonecutter or Lardoc for more information.

conversation.Kevin: Greetings Player, what brings you to the headquarter of the postmaster’s guild?
I am the head of the Tibian Postmaster’s Guild.
We are a powerful organisation that is a vital part of Tibian society. It’s an honour and a privilege to be a member.
You are already a member, Player.
My name is Kevin. Kevin Postner, that is.
Wally is my right hand, so to say. He is the head to our guild’s office branch.
Well, there’s the depot branch, the office brance, the delivery branch and some officers for special operations.
You have mastered all our current missions. There’s nothing left to be done … for now.
We have a secret branch, called ‘the stamps of the gods’. They secretly supervise our members’ reliability and have an eye on certain groups of interest that want to gain influence over our guild.
Ah, yes! One day I will found a post officers academy. Perhaps with the help of our most able members. But thats a task for another day.
Sorry, but you are not yet ready for advancement.
If you’d ask me – what you just did – it’s only a myth.

conversation.Grodrik: Leave me in peace. I don’t want to chat with humans. Got my own worries and problems.
One of the things you can’t have enough of.
Do I look that desperate? Stop breathing my air.
Yes! To the honour and strength of the dwarfs! <lifts his mug of beer>
I’m a smith – surprise. But dwarven smiths are so common that it’s hard to find a good position nowadays.
There aren’t enough women here, if you ask me. Particularly, not enough of the kind who are interested in me.
Huh? What do I look like, a babysitter? Find your own missions, I don’t have one for you.
: I’m Grodrik Hammertoe, son of Grimbul Hammertoe.
<sigh> My current problem is that my beer is empty. Got a mug of beer for me?
Spare me your do-gooding speech on ‘beer is bad’ yadayada or I’ll get angry. Sometimes a man needs his beer.

conversation.Note: It is possible to talk to Grodrik only when doing some missions during The Scatterbrained Sorcerer Quest. If you answer “yes” after the word “worries / problem” the conversation will go through the quest lines. You can read these lines for example here.

conversation.Gnomenezer: Hello Bigfoot. Be careful, it's dangerous downstairs. However, I can explain everything you need so don't fret.
I would recommend you to go to Gnomeral first, to learn more about what you can do here.

I am the gnomish overseer of the golem facility. That is I WAS the overseer until that earthquake drove all the golems nuts. Now all I can do is to explain what is happening here to helpers such as you.
Ok, your task here is quite simple. Well the task WOULD be simple, if you were a gnome. Sadly you are a ... uhm, something ... What is it they call you guys again? It was something like humus! ...

Don't tell me! Just a minute ... well while I think about it I can continue to explain your task to you. For the time being I'll call you a humus if need be. Now for your task, and this time please refrain from interrupting. ...
We have to get things done here, you know? However. The task is quite simple ... that is if ... no, wait, we had that already. So listen: ...
Plain and simple, so even a humus can understand it. Ahem, you don't mind being called a humus, do you? ...
It's only for the time being, as I said ... so now ... without further interruptions <gives you a stern look> you have to repair some of our crystal golems. ...
You know, they sometimes 'loose their music' as we say. The golems are controlled not by sentience but by complex melodies that dictate their actions. ...
The crystals vibrate in certain ways and react to certain vibrations in certain ways. I would explain it in more detail but I fear you could be a bit at a loss in face of gnomish crystallography. ...
In fact, I assume your head might explode if filled with too much gnomish knowledge. ...

So do you humus people have a brain in your heads like gnomes do, or is it in your stomach and your head more like a resonance body? I noticed you guys don't only have big feet but also quite loud voices. ...
Oh well, no time for that now. Please stick to the topic now. Or even better, just listen silently. So you might remember, golems, crystals, music etc.? ...
Well of course you do. So sometimes those golems get a disharmony by certain external effects beyond gnomish control. This is where you come into the play. ...

conversation.Brom: We both know it's the thrill of combat you're here for, so let's get to it. Just tell me if you're ready to fight or if you need me to explain everything to you.
I can give you details about the fighting rules for each mode, explain how to initiate a fight. I can also give you information on prizes.
First rule: every kill is justified in the arena. Otherwise, the PvP rules of your world will apply to the arena on your world. ...
As for the rest of the rules, the most important thing to know is that there is a time limit for each fight as well as right before a match. ...
After the fight has been initiated by giving me the necessary details, a timer will be started. ...
A fight is won if either only one player is left or only one team (at least one member of the team still standing at the end of a fight). ...
The fight will be canceled if the predetermined number of players for a fight does not show up in the anteroom. ...
If a fight is in progress but takes too long or no clear winner could be termined (this includes team fights were at least one member of both teams is still standing), it will be canceled as well.
Every premium player can participate in the arena. To initiate the arena, just talk to me and tell me if you want to play last man standing or a team deathmatch. ...
If the arena is not currently occupied you will then be able to tell me how many players will take part. You can also create one-on-one matches in both modes by adding only 2 players. ...
If you opted for a team deathmatch, you will have to select the members for each team by telling me the correct names. ...
After that you will have to specify the stakes for the fight.
I can give you information on stakes or how the prize money will be split in last man standing or team deathmatch mode.
Depending on the stake the initiating player has determined for a fight, each player will have to have this amount of gold on his or her bank account to take part. ...
As soon as the match starts (not while waiting or by entering an anteroom after the fight has been initiated), the money will be deducted. ...
Together, these stakes will add to the prize money, which will either go to the single winner of a last man standing fight or to the winning team in a team deathmatch. ...
If the match cannot be finished within the time limit, this money will be lost!
In a last man standing fight, the prize money which consists of all stakes of each player together, will go to the last player standing. ...
In a team deathmatch this money is split evenly among each player of the winning team (please note that the final share will be rounded down in case of uneven splits). ...
If a winning team consists of 5 players and only 2 members are still standing at the end of a fight, the money will still be split among all 5 members of the team.
Besides standing here? I'm taking care of the arena, what did you think? Greenhorns.
Brom's the name.
Doesn't matter to me what time it is. What matters to me is the arena.
Good fight, good night.

conversation.Alberto: Hello, brave fighter! What can I do for you? Do you want information, to exchange something or to simply talk?
I will hand out arena badges depending on your results in the PvE arena. You can keep them or exchange them for potions - with a chance to win a special surprise cube, just to spice things up a bit.
If you finish all 10 waves of an arena battle, you'll obtain a fixed amount of arena badges. The exact amount depends on the selected difficulty level. ...
I can check the total amount and offer you potions in exchange for them. Do you want me to hand out your arena badges now?
As a special service for our most valued customers, we hand out a surprise cube! By using it, you have a chance of getting nice little goodies.
Well, I guess you'd like to know what I'm doing here.
There are 5 difficulty levels when fighting against waves of monsters in the arena. Each difficulty level grants you a certain amount of arena badges which I will hand out to you. ...
Level 1 grants one badge, level 2 grants two, level 3 grants three, level 4 grants four and level 5 grants five arena badges.

It's quite easy. I give you arena badges for each completed arena battle. Surviving 10 waves against monsters in the arena will grant you a fixed amount of badges depending on the difficulty level. ...
You can keep the arena badges or exchange them for each kind of health, mana and spirit potions. I'll charge 1 arena badge for the amount of 100 mana or health potions. ...

100 strong potions of either mana or health will be charged with 2, 100 great health potions with 4 and 100 great mana potions with 3, 100 ultimate potions of either type with 7 and 100 supreme potions with 10 arena badges. ....
You can also select 100 great spirit potions for 4 and 100 ultimate spirit potions for 8 arena badges. ...
Would you like to exchange for health, mana or spirit potions now?
I specialised in trading potions in exchange for arena badges. Actually my whole family earns their living this way, you can meet my brothers and sisters by visiting the other arenas. ...
Maybe you'll even get to know my whole family someday!
My name is Alberto, pleased to meet you!
Take care and come back soon!

conversation.Rapanaio: Psht! Not that loud! Evil lurks everywhere. It’s after me!

Evil lurks everywhere. It only takes some ignorant or cowardly people to turn their heads away once too often for it to spread its ugly seeds. I, however, am constantly vigilant and always prepared. …
I hunt out the signs of evil everywhere. Even in the face of scorn and ridicule, I will not hide my head in the sand and I will be ready to fight!
Ignorance is evil’s most potent ally. The servants of evil are plotting to keep us ignorant and poke ridicule at those who come too close to the truth.
It is my calling to root out evil in all its forms and uphold the vigilant fight. It is a lonely fight, an unending fight, but someone has to do it! …
I scour ancient texts and collect rumours in taverns in order to track the machinations of evil. …
Often odd occurrences are overlooked by the public as strange coincidences or fate, but those who know what to look for see the footprints of evil in history.

When I found that ancient text, warning of the Isle of Evil, I tried to tell the world about it. But the forces of evil discovered my plans! They made people assume it was just another tale for children. …

THEY distributed a book of children’s bedtime stories with a copy of the text in it to undermine my message! Their despicable ruse worked and they made a laughing stock of me! Of course I knew it was a plot to discredit me. …
On the other hand, it was obvious that THEY now knew about me and the text I possessed. I went into hiding in fear of my life! THEY have tried to assassinate me! I must be constantly vigilant!
You’ll find it in one of my chests. It’s only a copy of course. The original is safely hidden! As much as THEY claim it’s only a children’s tale I know it’s the truth.
Bah, THEY forged a children’s book that made my source material look like some part of it. Of course it is an evil plot to prevent me from locating the isle and slaying its dark master. …
Or rather, sending some other hero who will fight the ultimate evil in its own lair on my behalf. Someone has to stay and fight the fight on the mainland, of course.
Evil follows a distinct pattern. It is nasty, plans to rule the world, discredits its enemies, is fond of cunning death traps and rambling monologues, …
it can only be vanquished by someone who completes a series of quests for some odd quest giver and it loves to have a lair, usually some sort of dungeon.
Scientists have no idea why the servants of evil are so fond of dungeons. But every evil mastermind worth his salt strives to own one. It is where it accomodates its minions and hoards its treasures.

Evil masterminds are served by all kinds of lesser evil beings. Such minions are usually no match for a hero, so they come in great numbers to counterbalance their lack of skill. Some minions are more capable. …

They often serve as some kind of overseer or enforcer of evil and guard the mastermind’s lair. Such minions are a particular challenge for a hero, but the rewards and loot for slaying them in battle are great!
I assume it is some kind of cosmic balance. When a hero slays a minion of evil the cosmic balance grants him some kind of reward. This often comes in the form of treasure. …
Sometimes it’s gold, sometimes it’s a special weapon or piece of armor. Often an evil mastermind employs overseers for its hordes who guard parts of its dungeon. …

These overseers are often in possession of high quality items that are the stuff of legend. The cosmic balance grants such items to the victorious hero so he can slay even more powerful minions of evil.
Call it what you like. I call it cosmic balance. It’s like a natural law. It is the force that inspires evil beings to build lairs and dungeons, inspires it to gather armies of minions and so on. …
It is the only rational way to explain such strange behaviour.
That heroes are rewarded with loot is down to the just nature of the cosmic balance. This is why even the most insignificant killer rat carries gold. …

This, by the way, is proof positive that rats are evil minions, or else they would not carry gold. Loot is usually in the form of gold, but occasionally it also comes in the form of equipment and weapons. …
Why else do dragons bother to carry armour and weapons when the beast itself is a killing machine with no use for such trinkets? It is of course cosmic balance! There is simply no other explanation!
My life is no longer safe. The first attempt on my life was at a party thrown by a fellow inventor. THEY put poison in one of the twenty pints of beer I drank that night. …
The following morning I was close to death. Only my strong dwarven constitution stood between me and the grim reaper that day. …
In their next attempt, assassins tinkered with the stairs in front of my favourite tavern. When I was leaving the tavern after a night with my friends I tripped and fell, nearly breaking my neck! …
Only my catlike reflexes saved my life that time. Well, my reflexes and my beard that absorbed some of the force of the fall. …
Other attempts on my life followed! Like the object that was hurled at me while I was singing and dancing on the bar while at a party. …
And the list goes on and on. I know that I am in grave danger and I will not lie to you about the danger you will be in when THEY learn about you.

THEY are the servants of evil. THEY are everywhere and could be anyone. In fact, it has crossed my mind that most of THEM don’t know who THEY are. Uhm, well, I mean THEY don’t even know each other. The lure of evil is powerful. …
Most people are not as strong as you and me and easily give in to the lure of wealth and power that evil promises. …
Uhm, what was that flicker in your eyes? Well, anyway, Evil recruits its minions from all weak willed creatures so you can’t be sure who is your enemy. …
I advise you to be cautious. Better safe than sorry. Or dead.
It is my calling to root out evil in all its forms and uphold the vigilant fight. It is a lonely fight, an unending fight, but someone has to do it! …
I scour ancient texts and collect rumours in taverns in order to track the machinations of evil. …
Often odd occurrences are overlooked by the public as strange coincidences or fate, but those who know what to look for see the footprints of evil in history.
My name is top secret!
I am an inventor and sage. I have pledged my life to fighting evil wherever it raises it’s ugly head. It’s hard work and you have to get your hands dirty, but someone has to do it.
<lowers his voice> Sorry, that information is strictly classified. THEY might capture and torture you to find out what you know.
It is my calling to root out evil in all its forms and uphold the vigilant fight. It is a lonely fight, an unending fight, but someone has to do it! …

You have no idea how many people laughed at me when I warned them of the Isle of Evil.

After constructing an evil-o-meter I set about finding places where evil was concentrated. It reacted as expected to places of great evil like the Ghostlands, the Plains of Havoc and the Edron ruins. …

But then it found somewhere new. My surprise knew no bounds when it showed a remote isle previously thought to be uninhabited. I am sure that something evil lurks there. Some unspeakable horror waiting to kill and devour unsuspecting travellers. …
I could not let that happen! So I did some research and as I was about to give up I stumbled upon an ancient text that told of the Isle of Evil! …
Immediately, the nature of the threat I had discovered became alarmingly clear! All I needed was a hero and some transport. But would they listen?! NO! They laughed at me. …
Well, that was where you stepped in. Now we have joined forces to save the world!
Take care and watch your back, Player.

conversation.Scutty: Hi there.
Human society has been polluted by the taint of magic like many of Tibia’s civilisations.

Sadly, even my own people distrust us and our technology to some extent. They think we are ‘different’ and some of the ancients condemn us because we don’t align ourselves with the elemental forces. …
It’s not that we don’t honour the elements, we do. But we have a different approach to honouring the elements. …
This difference is the source of the distrust, but despite this, our inventions have become an integral part of dwarven society and we are acknowledged for our accomplishments.
Magic is unreliable, restrictive and hampers progress. …
I know, you’re thinking ‘he’s just jealous and wants technomancy to get more attention’ but it’s not only technology that is held back by the quick fixes magic provides – society suffers as well. …
Consider this. There is a spell for everything so nobody tries to find alternative solutions for their problems – the need for creative thinking disappears and people become lazy. …

People become trapped by their superstions because they know someone only needs to mutter a few words to turn them into a frog and suddenly, the whole world is full of people putting the evil eye on you. …
They blame fate for their problems rather than taking responsibility for their own lives. . …
Of course, some of these arguments could be used against technology, but at least there is skill and thought behind technology, not just some hocus pocus gobbledygook!
Regardless of what those narrowminded spellcasters claim, technomancy is a science in its own right. It is much more precise than dabbling in magic and incomprehensible forces. …
And, what’s more, it’s based on logical thinking – not some freaky talent you have to be born with. …
Of course I understand why you humans prefer to rely on chance and childrens’ rhymes without having any true understanding of what you are doing. …
As a technomancer, you can at least work out your mistakes because they are based on logic, even if the mistake you have made is likely to have blown someone up . …
That does not make our interaction with dwarven society an easy one, but we get along well enough.
Dwarfs are a race apart – a unique race. …

I can fully understand the fact that other races such as humans and … um … elves and orcs and … um … cyclopes and … hm … flies and so on are in awe of us. But for us, our genius is an everyday fact of life. …
Nevermind, human. Your inferiority is not your fault. Not every race can be as gifted as we are. Not that I mean to be rude or anything.

Hah! Elves! So blinded by their attachment to magic. If you were to ask them how a bow and arrow worked, they would probably tell you the spirits of the air carry their arrows to the hearts of their enemies! …
They don’t have the slightest idea of mechanics or physics.

Yes, yes. Fascinating issue. Hmm. Let’s see .. I don’t know too much about golems themselves, but I have a good idea about the mechanics involved. After researching some material that Telas sent me I was able to work out some crucial information. …
Using the information I have put together, Telas should be able to pass on the specs to the blacksmiths. At least he can get the mechanical components organised.
Ah, yes, Telas. Quite smart for someone that tall.
Oh please. If you don’t know what mechanics are about, go and find another dwarf who has a century to spare to explain it all to you. …
I have more important things to do than show a human what a spanner is for.
From what has reached my ears it’s quite a sight. I am not a big traveller so I don’t really have an opinion and wouldn’t be able to tell the difference between the truth and exaggeration. …
But the word is that these Yalahari don’t care much about keeping their machines in a good shape. What are they thinking of? Don’t they know that a machine must be tended and cared for? …
There is something odd going on in that city, I tell you. No-one who builds such wonders grows that careless.

Strange people, but that’s no surprise considering they are not dwarfs. They had a good hand for technology though. Unfortunately they mixed it with magic which to my mind is as bad as watering beer, a crime! …
Still, there is certainly a lot to be learned from their inventions. But they keep their secrets well guarded. I can understand and appreciate that.

What kind of a silly question is that? But fine: a machine is something that can do everything you can but twice as efficiently. And no, despite these qualities it doesn’t have a tail, fur and above all, it doesn’t eat bananas!
My greatest invention was the improved lift system that we used on the farms. It was by far more efficient and fast than the old ones. And what did those technophobic dwarfs go and do? …
They made me a lift boy out of gratitude! They insisted that I had to operate it to guarantee its safety. What a joy I tell you! ‘Lift me up Scutty’ the whole stupid day! …
Great! It took years for them to get used to the lift and let me move on to my other projects.
As you can see, I’m the tooth fairy. I collect children’s teeth and wear a tutu and fly. …

Ask a stupid question, get a stupid answer! What do you think all these machines are for? Why are my hands black with machine oil and why am I wearing a tool belt? No, I am not an unhygienic tooth fairy. …
I am a technomancer! Master of machines and mechanics!
Scutty is the name. I’ll spare you the part that only dwarfs can pronounce.
Yeah, bye.

conversation.Xelvar: Greetings. Are you interested in adventures?
Right now I am sort of recruiting people.
Right now I am sort of recruiting people.
I told you basically everything you have to know about the gnomes.
So here we go.
The gnomes preferred to keep our alliance and their whole existence a secret. They are a bit distrustful of others. …

They are quite self-sufficient and the fact that they are actually accepting some help is more than alarming. The gnomes are in real trouble and I am kind of an ambassador to find some people willing to help.

Gnomes … ah. You will see for yourself. You will need some good nerves though, I’m warning you. But I have to admit those gnomes are a capable lot and valuable allies. Their incredible self-esteem sometimes is irritating though. …

I guess though you’d need such a mindset to survive in an environment as they are living in. Don’t underestimate them ever. I have seen some of the things the gnomes have fought and they have fought them for centuries. …
I have to admit that even dwarfs would be hard pressed to best such foes and circumstances.
The gnomes are locked in a war with an enemy that thins out their resources but foremost their manpower. We have suggested that people like you could be just the specialists they are looking for. …
If you are interested to join the gnomish cause I can arrange a meeting with their recruiter.
I already gave you instructions and teleport crystals. Now be on your way.

The lost are a dire burden to our hearts. In the time of struggles when our whole race was threatened with extinction, we travelled under the great old one for protection. The journey was dangerous and long. …
During our travels several dwarfs were lost. Some even disagreed with our course and suggested a seemingly less dangerous path. Well I can’t tell what happened to most of them. …
What we do know is that there are at least two other factions of dwarfs remaining. …

For one there are those of Beregar who still claim to be the ‘true’ dwarfs and that we are a mere splinter group of their stronghold, which is entirely wrong and disproven by our records. Then there are the lost. …

Well here I have to speculate what has happened. One possibility is, that the lost are another group that chose another path in the great march. They might have hidden for a while before they fell prey to their future slavers. …
Another possibility is that those dwarfs that later defected to the city of Beregar were no story made up by the Beregar dwarfs to justify their claims, …
but they actually existed and it was them who were enslaved by those who the gnomes call ‘those below’. …
Whoever their ancestors were, now they are deranged slaves that only physically resemble dwarfs. They have become … something different. …
Their eyes are dead and they even behave like some undead. In battle they turn into almost mindless killing machines. They know no mercy, neither do they expect some. …
They are truly the lost in more than one meaning. I pity them enough to gladly end their miserable existence whenever possible.
Sorry you will have to ask the gnomes on that topic and even they seem to know only some vague things about them.
Ok, come back if you changed your mind.
Our races have known each other for centuries. We encountered each other sometimes when in the depth of the earth. Some of those meetings played out nasty. …
We later learned that the gnomes had encountered the lost and fought fierce battles against them. Of course they would assume that we are in league with their enemies. …
Eventually we managed to end this misunderstanding. But that is a story to be told another time.

On my suggestion the gnomes reluctantly agreed to acquire the help of some adventurers. They are trying to gather some kind of brigade. After all this scepticism I faced, I am somewhat at loss at the enthusiasm the gnomes show towards this idea now. …
But this is the gnomish way it seems. If they do something they do it with dedication and they do not do things by half it seems.
Our alliance is an old one, though only based on exchange of equipment so far. Admittedly the gnomes work wonders with crystals and mushrooms, but they are at a loss when it comes to working metal. …
If we combine our knowledge in some effective way, who knows what wonders might spawn some day.
The Spike is a different branch of the gnomish operations. You might volunteer there without great formalities. …
It’s a strange marvel of gnomish crystal growing techniques. They are kind of running into too much trouble to handle it on their own and need help of heroes experienced and greenhorns.
I guess the time of secrecy is over now. Well, we have an old alliance with another underground dwelling race, the gnomes.
Good bye. Come back soon.

conversation.Tylius: Hello there! I see you had fun in the close combat tent, that's great! Now, this is the distance fighting tent. In here, you can test staffs that sorcerers and druids use. Want to give it a go? Say yes.

Hahah, eager to roast some party skeletons, eh? Still, sorcerer and druids are distance fighters. That means they do NOT touch the monsters. Mainly because their defense and armor is a lot weaker. On the other hand, their damage output is far greater ...

You need to find the right distance. If too far away, the staff won't work; if too close, you will receive a heavy beating from the monster. First, EQUIP your new staff in the WEAPON SLOT in your inventory, ...
then RIGHT-CLICK on a monster on the map or battle list and choose 'ATTACK'. ...

Remember that a staff like this also USES MANA, so make sure you grab some FOOD and eat it. You can find food in the chest on the way to the next tent as well as some blueberry bushes. Mana will only be regenerated inside tents. ...
Alright, here you go! Have fun with the staff. Don't forget that you need to drag your staff from the inventory to your weapon slot. If you've had enough, just go to the next tent!

conversation.Neill: Why hello there, young initiate! Welcome to your festival! ...
That's right! I said, your festival! We, residents of the Island of Destiny, have decided to put up a Festival of Initiates just for you newcomers, isn't that great?
Yes, the Festival is a great idea! See, you will have to choose a vocation soon, and this festival is here to help you decide! All of us will be happy to explain things to you. Just ask!

That means you need to choose what you are going to be - a Knight, a Paladin, a Druid or a Sorcerer. Each of these vocations is going to feel different. They are lifetime jobs, if you will. But enough talk. I bet you want to start, yes?

Alright, let's go! Here in this tent you can try if you like close combat and melee fighting. That means, in a fight you will be close to monsters and have physical contact with them. You need a good defense and hitpoints for this kind of fight. Ready?

OK. Here is your sword. Remember: Knights always are at the front, they need good armor and many hitpoints. They can't really fight at a distance, or heal others. Always have a health potion ready! ...
Oh, and if you lost your shield, take one from the box, left of the entrance. You can only shield yourself from 2 enemies at once, though. ...
Proceed to the next tent if you are done testing close combat, and have fun!

conversation.Weaponmaster: Hello Player! I have already heard about you! As our newest member you are eligible to be granted a weapon of your choice!
You can choose a daramian mace, a steel axe or a jagged sword!
The first rule of club fighting is: you do not talk about club fighting! But let us ignore this rule for a moment. ...
The daramian mace is obviously used in the mace fighting style. Maces tend to be a bit more defensive then other weapon category. ...
This becomes especially interesting when using two handed weapons without the protection of a shield. So shall the daramian mace become your weapon of choice?

The steel axe suits the style of axe fighters well. Axes tend to be better for attacking then for defense, which becomes most important while using two handed weapons. Do you really want to choose the steel axe as your weapon?

Sword fighting is a balanced style, not giving up attack power for defense or the other way round. Swords are not as damaging as comparable axes or defensive as comparable maces but does neither share their weaknesses. ...
Do you want to take the jagged sword as your first weapon?

conversation.Weaponmasterr: And here it is! Your first weapon of knighthood! May it serve you well. Remember this choice does not restrict you to this weapon type. You can train your weapon skills freely as it pleases you.

You see that CHEST over there? Take some spears out of it and see if you can hit the party skeletons over there. Be careful not to hit yourself, though. There's a chance your spear may BREAK - if so, get a new one from the chest every 60 seconds. ...

You need to equip your spear in your weapon slot, RIGHT-CLICK on a MONSTER on the map or BATTLE LIST, then choose 'ATTACK'. If you are done with it like me, proceed to the next tent. Which I can't. <sigh>

conversation.Ceiron: Hello there, Player. What do you want?

I know where the great wolf mother lives, but I won’t tell that to just anyone. You have to earn my respect first by completing my tasks.
Together we have roamed the wilderness of Tibia, hunting side by side… I prefer the company of wolves to humans. A wolf will not betray its pack.

Did you bring me a sample of the water from the hydra cave?
I guess that spot is not easy to find. Don’t give up.
Demon dust is the very essence of a demon’s malicious core. It can only be retrieved when using a stake blessed by a priest on the fresh corpse.
Bears are the darker part of the dark behind the trees, deep in the forest.
I can only give you one container, sorry. If you lose it, you have to buy one from a representative of the explorer’s society.

The Griffinclaw flower is said to bloom rarely, maybe once each few weeks. Strangely enough, it can survive on the bleak mountains of Nargor, and apparently only there. It is one of Crunor’s masterpieces.
Have you lost my waterskin?
Good for you.
Have you lost my waterskin?
I can give you a new one, but I fear that I have to take a small fee for it. Would you like to buy a waterskin for 1000 gold?

Have you lost my waterskin?
I can give you a new one, but I fear that I have to take a small fee for it. Would you like to buy a waterskin for 1000 gold?
Here. Don’t lose it again.

conversation.Amarie: I really have to study, I’m sorry. Please leave me alone with my books.
Oh, those coarse barbarians!
I’m a scholar. I believe that the ultimate aim in life is the pursuit of perfect knowledge through study.
It’s pretty here with all these trees and flowers.
Mission? You should read more books. Take that as your mission.
Well… maybe there is a chance for me to find love, after all…
My name is Amarie Leafdancer.
Yes, interesting, isn’t it? I could read about them all day.
Do you like books, too? I really think there’s nothing better than a good book and a cup of bug milk to relax.
Oh, you’re interested in what I study? Really? <blushes> That’s unusual. Well, it’s about the… no wait. I don’t want to bore you. Are you really interested?
Wow. Okay… it’s about the… <blushes even more> well… social interaction of milkbugs in their m… mating season.
It’s really sweet and nutritious. You should try it while you’re in Ab’Dendriel.
Sigh… so caring, yes. <gets a dreamy look in her eyes> Sometimes I dream of…. ah .. forget what I said. <blushes>
What do I dream of? I think… no one has asked me that for a long time. In my favourite book it says… oh, but it isn’t really interesting.
My favourite book… is an erm… poetry book. Which I shouldn’t waste my study time on, but… poetry can also be meaningful.
Meaningful like… it really touches something deep inside your heart and that just makes perfect sense to you.
I… don’t know how I can explain that better.
No, no, that’s getting far too personal… <blushes>
I… don’t know how I can explain that better.
Would you like me to… re… recite some poetry? <blushes>
Really… okay. I’ll tell you my favourite. Maybe you’ll like it too… <smiles shyly> It’s an elven poem, but I’ll translate it for you. Here goes: …
‘Alas, her pale face up in the starry sky …
Flaunting a light that is not hers …
Lost in reverie to dance with the fervid sun …
Yet knowing that this day will never dawn …
For with the dawn she fades …
And only when darkness engulfs her …
Will her light shine the brightest.’ …
<blushes> So… what do you think? Did you like the poem?

Oh, do you really mean it? That’s so nice, finally someone who understands me. <smiles and claps her hands> Maybe you will understand my dreams as well. Or… I’m getting carried away. My dreams are a little confusing. …
And I don’t think there’s a chance that I’ll ever find what I’m really looking for. <sighs> I guess I shall have to resign myself to a long, lonely life without love…
Love? Hah… you don’t know me. I’m really not good at this stuff. Or what is it you’re implying?
Well… maybe there is a chance for me to find love, after all…
Asha Thrazi.

conversation.A Wrinkled Bonelord: What’s this? An optically challenged entity called Player. How fascinating!
I’m the great librarian of this library of a once great city.
So much knowledge was lost in the great wars when we had to retreat to hidden places beneath the surface …
Most of our data storages are lost and so are the means to read or recreate some of them …
We had to use the primitive storage form of books to recreate some of the lost knowledge. In the past, we used far more advanced forms of storage …
Such as bound spirits but also means your puny brain would never be able to comprehend.
It’s a fine library, isn’t it? All this knowledge! All those books!
Our books are written in 469, of course you can’t understand them.
The language of my kind. Superior to any other language and only to be spoken by entities with enough eyes to blink it.
Our language is beyond comprehension by your lesser beings. It heavily relies on mathemagic …
Your brain is not suited for the mathemagical processing necessary to understand our language …
To decipher even our most basic texts, it would need a genius that can calculate numbers within seconds in his brain.
You pitiful two-eyed creatures. In our eyes, you look weird. It is pathetic how much you depend on hands and legs …
Since we bonelords have more eyes than any creature in the world, it is obvious that you can determine the value of a species by the number of its eyes.
The world is full of inferior species. Once, our race ruled the whole world, but then the gods destroyed our empire …
But our race is proficient in the return from death. One day we will rise again, that’s for sure!
This city is nothing but a pale shadow compared to the cities of the past. Our race was forced to retreat to such insignificant underground outposts after the wars.
Our race has fought many wars in the past and has won most of them. Sometimes, though, it takes only one loss to bring a race down …
All the more if the gods you are fighting for, turn out to be traitors.
Our race is very old. Over the time, we have been given many different names by other races …
The term bonelord sticks to us for quite a while now …
In our language the name of our race is not fixed but a complex formula, and as such it always changes for the subjective viewer.
I’m 486486 and NOT ‘Blinky’ as some people called me … before they died. So don’t … confuse your numbers, as my kind says.
Interesting how foolish you are. Take this and see how long you’ll last.
Numbers are essential. They are the secret behind the scenes. If you are a master of mathematics, you are a master over life and death.
Yes, yes, I’ll kill you soon enough, now let me continue my investigations about you.
Go and wash your eyes for using this obscene number!
I heard that elves moved in upstairs.
They will mourn the day they abandoned us.
Their mages are so close to the truth. Closer than they know and closer than it’s good for them.
Noisy pests.
Only inferior species need weapons.
It’s 1, not ‘Tibia’, silly.
Ugliness incarnated. Only one eye! Imagine that! How horrible!
Good tools to work with … once they are dead, that is.
These fools and their superstitious life cult don’t understand anything of importance.
Wait right there. I’ll eat you right after writing down what I found out.

conversation.Tigo: There, there initiate. You will now become one of us, as so many before you. One of the Barkless. Walk with us and you will walk tall my friend.
My name is Tigo, Beacon of the Barkless.
I am Beacon of the Barkless and one of the first to join the circle of the Penitent. Only one of us can be Beacon. My job is to gather like-minded and oversee their material sacrifices.
There, there initiate. You will now become one of us, as so many before you. One of the Barkless. Walk with us and you will walk tall my friend.
The Penitent is the first and truest of the Barkless. Our spiritual leader. He walked the face of this world in suffering and pain for us to be freed from misery on the other side. ...
Only he can judge if our brothers and sisters are pure enough to approach him.
When you are free from vanity and fortune, you shall receive purification. Then, and only then, the Penitent will judge you. Survive the trial of tar, sulphur and ice.
Purification is but one of the difficult steps on your way to the other side. The trial of tar, sulphur and ice.
The trial consists of three steps. The trial of tar, where you will suffer unbearable heat and embrace the stigma of misfortune. ...

The trial of sulphur, where you will bathe in burning sulphur and embrace the stigma of vanity. Then, there is the trial of purification. The truest of us will be purified to face judgement from the Penitent. ...
To purge your soul, your body will have to be near absolute zero, the point where life becomes impossible. ...
Something about you is different. I know that you will find a way to return even if you should die during the purification. And if you do... Leiden will become aware of you and retreat. ...
If he does, follow him into his own chambers. Barkless are neither allowed to go near the throne room, aside from being judged, nor can we actually enter it. ...
He should be easy to defeat with his back to the wall, find him - and deliver us from whatever became of the Penitent.
You are now one of us. Learn to endure this world's suffering in every facet and take delight in the soothing eternity that waits for the purest of us on the other side.

conversation.Tooth Fairy: You've got me, I really have a little problem here. What gave it away? My sorrowful expression? Yes, I thought so. This is what troubles me: I'm the tooth fairy. Well, this wouldn't be a problem at all under normal circumstances. ...

I love gathering children's milk teeth and bringing presents for them. Until now, I did so by using a spell. This spell teleported me into the children's bedrooms and - after carrying out my duty - back to my secret realm. ...

But then I made the mistake of using a magical portal and entering this part of the world. Everything is strange and different here and the worst thing: my spells don't work! It will take some time until I can use the portal again. ...
Thus I'm stuck here for a while. But there are some children who lost their first milk tooth and are now waiting for their presents. Without my spells, I'm feeling utterly helpless. ...
I don't dare going to their homes at night but I know they will be sad about the missing presents. Would you help me?

Thank you very much, human being! You have to find three children: Quero's daughter in Thais, Allen's son in Venore and Rowenna's daughter in Carlin. Go to their bedrooms and find their milk teeth. ...
Usually they put them on their bed stands. Then you have to put the gifts on their beds. Please take these presents and go to Thais, Carlin and Venore. Come back with the milk teeth.

You're bringing the milk teeth! Thank you, human being; you were of great assistance to me! Please take this in return. It's the part of a map. If you find the other parts, it will show you the way to a hidden fairy treasure. ...
Oh, and if you're interested, there's still another cause you could help me with.
As I'm the tooth fairy it should not surprise you to hear that I have a small collection. Yes, a tooth collection, of course. But I'm still lacking some special specimens. ...
I would give you a little reward if you bring me one of the following - or all of them: an orc tooth, a shark tooth, a vampire tooth, a behemoth fang, a carrion worm fang or a werewolf fangs.
Oh, I see! You really found an orc tooth for me! Thank you, human being! Please take this in return.

conversation.Gruffy: Hello there Player! It's good to see you.
The Combined Magical Winterberry Society and its members try to ensure the harvesting and processing of winterberries to all sorts of useful, magical fluids.
The Combined Magical Winterberry Society was founded more than one hundred years ago by mage Tolwyn Winter. ...
It is our duty to ensure the harvesting and processing of winterberries to secure a steady flow of the appropriate magical resources for potions and other magical fluids in this world. ...
What? No, all further information is on a... a 'need to know' basis. Where? No! That's not - I mean I won't tell you where our... IF we even HAVE any headquarters.
Alright, first thing is - you deliver your berries and put them into one of the moulds over there. We need to fill the vat with berries before the actual treading can start. ...

When enough winterberries have been put into the moulds, the vat is full and the treading starts. When this time has come, everyone needs to enter the vat and start TREADING like they never trod before. ...
It's possible that you may have to deal with the berry pest, a whole swarm of small flying buggers who will try to feed on the winterberries. ...
If that happens, you will have to remove them. All of them, or the treading cannot continue. ...
Depending on the state of the berries, you will need to add water or sugar to the mix after some time. I will tell you which, just listen to me when the time comes. ...
Whenever you want to return to Thais, simply ask me to transport you back. And that's basically it. All clear or do you want me to repeat it?
Winterberries are special berries only harvestable during a short time of the year. They are used to refine potions of all sorts. They can severely enhance their magical effects. ...
Without them it is generally a little more difficult to create effective potions.
We oversee the treading of winterberries in all of Tibia. The processed berries will be used to refine magical potions such as health or mana potions.
Name's Gruffy, I'm a proud *sigh* representative of the... etcetera, etcetera... Combiwintersociety etcetera. You get the idea. ...
As you probably already know, we have a mission for you - and, based on your presence here, I assume you recently accepted to help us.

conversation.Llathriel: I greet thee, Player. What brings you here?
I am a mystic of the Cenath caste.
I connect beings. Souls. Lives. You humans call the ceremony a wedding.

If you wish to initiate a marriage ceremony, each of you need to give me a blank wedding ring and a box with a wedding outfit. Player, do you have a wedding ring and outfit with you and can give them to me now?
Not all Cenath are as arrogant as our reputation suggests. However, there is sadly some truth in this stereotype.
Support the local elfish economy! Briasol here in Ab’Dendriel just happens to have some in stock.
You can buy a box with your wedding outfit from the tailor Norbert in Venore.
My name is Llathriel Hopedawner.
Our people are the children of light and darkness, the heirs of dusk and dawn.
If you’re indicating that our underground tunnels were dug by dwarfs, you’re wrong. We just used what was already there. It is not our way to force nature to our will!
I’ve lived among humans for a while and get along with most of them.
I cannot understand how one could possibly reside above a swamp. The rotten stench offends my nose even from the dwarf bridge.
The druids of Carlin are striving to live in peace with nature and they’re doing quite well, for humans.
Don’t mention that filth hole in front of me!
I’ve heard your legends about that. You humans always believe that power is to be gained through wielding metal. If you lived as long as we do, you would be wiser.
Magic surrounds us constantly. Some beings have receptors for this kind of power, like us Cenath.
Not all Cenath are as arrogant as our reputation suggests. However, there is sadly some truth in this stereotype.
Unfortunately they left us long ago. But I believe some day we will be united again with both Abdaisim and the long lost Teshial.
The Teshial had impressive powers over dreams and could work their magic in them. Even though they are physically absent, I believe they still exercise their influence over our dreams.
Asha Thrazi, human child.

If you wish to initiate a marriage ceremony, each of you need to give me a blank wedding ring and a box with a wedding outfit. Player, do you have a wedding ring and outfit with you and can give them to me now?

To become a child of light and darkness you have to pass through the labyrinth. Enter the teleporter in the middle and you are one of us.
You can find it within the city walls in the south-west. The bushes there grow very fast so you would be well advised to take a machete to get through them.
Praise him! The life-giving father of trees. Though many elves have abandoned their belief in our Gods, I worship Crunor, Nera, Priyla and Krynierr.
She’s the lady of spring. Just look around you and see her work her magic! Haven’t you ever wondered why Ab’Dendriel is always blooming, always green?
The daughter of the stars and closely related to mystery and magic. What a gift she has given to us!
He is also known as ‘the silver tongue’. Without his inspiration, poetry, love and music would be unknown art forms in Tibia. He enriches our spiritual lives.
Our Deraisim brothers and sisters are skilled huntsmen and providers of food.
A divorce? You humans never cease to amaze me. Sorry, but what I have bound is meant to last for eternity. Maybe you’ll find another priest for that if you’re desperate enough.
From what humans tell me, he is supposed to be a wise man. To us elves he seems like a young and inexperienced adolescent
The Kuridai are quite hot-tempered, especially for elves. They would never accept humans in Ab’dendriel if it wasn’t for the other castes, who protect your interests.
I connect beings. Souls. Lives. You humans call the ceremony a wedding.
I heard the new human settlement in the west has become independent from the human empire.
Love is timeless. At least for elves. Humans may have a different view on that.
