conversation.Ghost Captain: Greetings Player! Are you ready to help me?
Read the manuals that should be lying around here. Some of my former helpers wrote all that stuff down to assist those who might come after them. ...
It is IMPORTANT that you understand the procedure. As soon as we embark on our journey, we will have only a few moments to get to the battle stations until the trouble begins. ...
It's not easy to sail through the netherworld, so don't make it harder by missing vital facts.
You have to man all stations. Each station must be attended by one person. Read the manual over there, it will help you significantly. ...
You'll have to act swiftly and correctly, else we'll lose our chance to chart the waters of the nether. If you fail on your duties on the ship, we have lost this opportunity, too.
If we fail, I will have to gather new strength and we have to try it anew after a while.
I've lost my name along with the chance to pass into the afterlife. One day I may have a name again, but only to be mourned since I will finally rest in peace then.
What do you think? I'm dead and forgotten. I'm just a shadow of the man I used to be. I'm a ghost now.
Just like me, my ship is not from this world anymore. We belong to another world now and it's hard to pass into the world of the living. ...

I can twist myself through the barrier sometimes but to get my ship through it requires more power than I've got available. For this reason we needed the power of the spectral scum you caught earlier. ...

This way we do not only put those lost souls to rest, but also gather the energy that is needed to get the ship through the barrier of worlds. With my ship here, we might be able to reach the Mourning Isles.

The Mourning Isles are a place of dread and despair. Since ancient times it has been a place where pirates of many races and nations hid their treasures and left unwanted individuals to await their death. ...
Often the treacherous waters of the isles sunk ships and stranded their crews on these godforsaken rocks. Many people died and cursed the isles. ...
So these isles are haunted since the dawn of mankind. The ghosts there lured even more ships on the reefs and the dreaded fame of the isles made them a popular hiding and detention spot. ...
Nowadays, no ordinary ship would manage to reach this isle. But my ghost ship might make it. ...
I will not lie to you though. Our journey will probably be as futile as all others before. ...
But with each successful try we are getting a bit closer to the isle. We just have to stand the perils of the nether long enough so that I can complete my maps of the nether a bit more. ...
Even if I won't reach the isle during your lifetime, your help will never be forgotten my friend.
Over the centuries, my ship has become more of an entity than an ordinary ghost ship. ...
It's been my only ally throughout the ages, well almost. We've been through a lot of tough things and I want you to treat my ship with respect. ...
The most living parts of the ship, save for the hull itself, are the soul core and the spirit flame. ...
You can reach the ship by using the mechanism in the south. Four of you have to stand on the plates when one of you pulls the lever. All of you have to be aligned to the same spirit mark though.

The hull is made by spectral wood and can easily stand the spirit storms of the netherworld. Still, it is a great danger that the wood is satiated so much with spirit energy that is becomes a feast for those damn ghost rats. ...
Gladly we still have some good old ghost dusters in the ship, they'll teach them a lesson. Still, these rats can do considerable damage to the hull if no one takes care of them.
It's hard to describe what it is exactly. I'd call it the ship's heart and soul. ...
You can literally see the ship's health and well-being by inspecting the core. If the core is damaged, it is a really baaaad thing, you know!? ...
The good thing is that soul sparks, which are quite common in these parts of the netherworld, emit a strengthening aura that can fix any damage of the core. ...
They have to be led to the core though since they are only attracted by living creatures.
The flame is what keeps the ship moving. Elements are not common here in the netherworld and are a powerful source of energy. ...
The spirit flame charges itself on energy of certain elements. These elements have to be distributed to the corresponding shrines. ...
When a shrine obtains the correct energy charge, it fuels the spiritual force of the ship and reinvigorates the spirit flame in return. ...
If this delicate balance were ever to break, we would lose our energy source and couldn't continue our travel through the netherworld or even strand here.
Good bye, Player.

conversation.Lucius: Bring some light to the world in these dark days!

Greetings, Player.

Greetings, Player! We have no time to waste. Let's talk about an urgent mission.

This is the time of the year where demons try hardest to break through to our world. I try my best to keep them away by spiritually empowering those magical fire basins here in the Temple of Light. ...
However, I cannot be everywhere at the same time, and there are ten spots all over Tibia where the layer between our world and the hellish world is especially thin. ...
You need to travel to these places within a day after I gave you a magical torch. I summoned a lightbearer's basin there, similar to those here in the temple. ...
You have to use the torch on a basin to power its light. Then it will have regain enough energy to burn brightly for another two hours. ...
If you look at a basin, you can see how much energy there is still left. As long as all fire basins are burning, no creatures will be able to enter Tibia. ...
However, when only one fire basin turns dark and disappears, powerful demons will be unleashed onto this world. ...
You have to keep the fire burning for five days, and on the last day the demons will be so weakened that you can dispose of them easily when they come. ...
I can give you only one torch which lasts for a day and will then disappear. Also, you can only use your torch ONCE on each basin. ...
Thus you need to work together with your fellow Tibians, so that someone can always keep the fire basins burning, on each of the five days. ...
I can either give you the torch now - but remember it will only last for a day - or hold onto it for you until your time to be a lightbearer has come. Do you want that torch right now?
Good, then wait for a while. But don't wait too long.
Here is your torch, Player. Please try to keep all ten spots burning, and remember you can only use your torch ONCE on each spot. ...
And be careful - evil might send its minions there from time to time to keep you from lighting the basin.

conversation.Dermot: Hello, traveller Player. How can I help you?
I am the magistrate of this isle.
I am Dermot, the magistrate of this isle.
Time is not important on Fibula.
You are at Fibula. This isle is not very dangerous. Just the wolves bother outside the village.
Oh, my god. In the dungeon of Fibula are a lot of monsters. That's why we have sealed it with a solid door.
Do you want to buy the dungeon key for 2000 gold?

The inhabitants of Fibula live on fishing, farming, and hunting.

conversation.Boveas: Hi! I hope you’re not going to kill me!
Oh, I’m sorry. I forgot to introduce myself. Tends to happen when I’m scared that some bloodthirsty adventurer is going to kill me on account of my cunning disguise. My name is Boveas.
Believe me, it wasn’t easy to create this disguise. I employed the finest leather workers of Tibia to sew it together while I was studying the behaviour of cows on some of the farms. …
Admittedly the research was a waste of time as minotaurs have very little in common with cows. And the cow suit does get a peculiar smell after a while. However, you live and learn, don’t you?
I studied the art of magic for many years, but it’s a bit abstract for a man with my hands on attitude to life. …
Unfortunately, that proved to be far too much for one person. After careful consideration I decided to concentrate my efforts on the secrets of minotaur magic. …
I have invested a considerable amount of resources in setting up this ruse to infiltrate this city. …
Minotaurs are absolutely fascinating! Their culture, their philosophy, their everyday life. All of it is full of surprises and there is so much to learn. …
Believe me, it wasn’t easy to create this disguise. I employed the finest leather workers of Tibia to sew it together while I was studying the behaviour of cows on some of the farms. …
Admittedly the research was a waste of time as minotaurs have very little in common with cows. And the cow suit does get a peculiar smell after a while. However, you live and learn, don’t you?
Sadly, Mintwalin is only a shadow of what it could have been. The minotaurs were hiding from numerous foes when they built this city. They had to use what was at their disposal. …

Given that, the city is something they can be proud of. They had so few resources and they were forced to adapt much of their magic. Their magic specialised in war spells and they had to refocus onto a kind of supply magic to make everyday life work …
The first time I came here I actually wondered whether the minotaurs might actually be more civilized then we are. The more time I spend here, the more this seems to me to be the case. …
The minotaurean civilisation rivals our own and it is tragic that we are bitter enemies.
The King of the minotaurs is actually not all that different from other sovereigns. At least, he seems to be confronted with similar challenges and issues just like any leader of a nation.

I doubt I could infiltrate the ranks of the Yalahari .. Hmm, then again, that certainly would be a challenge! I might consider that option when I have completed studying the minotaurs. But my work here is far from over <sigh>.

I have been here for a long time, so you probably know more about the Yalahari than do I. It might be that the Yalahari have knowledge that will give Telas the insight necessary to make that break through that eluded me when I was researching golems.

I’m a scientist. But unlike my bookish colleagues I prefer to be out in the field, living the research, not just reading it. That’s why I came here, to learn first hand about the minotaurs, their civilisation, their society.
Ah, good old Telas. A genius but a notorious bookworm. Personally, I don’t have the patience for sitting around in a laboratory, tinkering and experimenting. …
I like to get my hands dirty, so to speak. Field work is the only way for me to further my researches in an adequate way.
Before I turned my attention to minotaur lore, I was researching the construction of golems. Finally I reached a point where I felt a breakthrough was imminent. …
But months turned to years and the break through eluded me. After years of stagnation and frustration I moved on and never looked back …
I am willing to part with the information I have gathered so far in the hope I can assist Telas in his researches. May he be successful where I failed. …
I will mail him my research papers immediately.
There are some similarities between the minotaurean culture and our own but there are also huge differences. …

The most important difference is perhaps that much of their culture evolved to help them deal with their rage, their inner beast. But there are other differences of course, some subtle, some prominent. …
But I am not going to spill the beans! As soon as my field work has been completed I am going to write a book! …
If you are truly interested in minotaurean lore and secrets you should really look forward to that book. …
I have not decided on a title yet but I just know it will be a best seller – so you are bound to hear about it on the Tibian grapevine! Once it is released, of course.
All dragons look alike to me.
Good bye, Player.

conversation.Noozer: Hm? Oh! Oh, yes a... visitor! Intruder? Benefactor...? Wha- what are you? If you want to pass through this cave, I may have to disappoint you. Or maybe not. It... depends. So, just passing through?.
Yes, yes. Or wait - why do you want to.. ah what does it matter. So you want to get through these caves, fine. But be warned! ...
...wait a second, I lost it. What was I going to say again? Ah yes - DANGEROUS! These. Caves. Are. Dangerous. No way you get out alive. Ever. Again. ...
Also you should not disturb those... people down there. Yeah. They... hm, wait, they - who are they again? Hey! Who are you? Are you talking to me?! Ah, ah... oh yes, I remember. ...
Wait - I am the guardian here, yes! The keeper of... something... or another, yes, I... guard this place. With my life. Don't I? Of course! ...

Is, er... this the moment where I should try to... stop you? Yes? No? Ah, you know what - you go down there, those guys are angry as dung anyway. Try your luck, return to me when you're done. If you still can. Or not.
Then don't waste my time. I'm doing some important... business... here. Actually... where am I? If I find out, I will be even more angry than I am now. Out of my sight.
I was stationed in this cave to... guard something. Right now I am not even sure what that was.
I was on a mission, too - I guess. It was all quite blurry back then. Maybe I'll leave this place after I recovered completely. I have to find out what happened to me.

conversation.Lorenzo: Hello, brave fighter! What can I do for you? Do you want information, to exchange something or to simply talk?
I will hand out arena badges depending on your results in the PvE arena. You can keep them or exchange them for potions - with a chance to win a special surprise cube, just to spice things up a bit.
If you finish all 10 waves of an arena battle, you'll obtain a fixed amount of arena badges. The exact amount depends on the selected difficulty level. ...
I can check the total amount and offer you potions in exchange for them. Do you want me to hand out your arena badges now?
There are 5 difficulty levels when fighting against waves of monsters in the arena. Each difficulty level grants you a certain amount of arena badges which I will hand out to you. ...
Level 1 grants one badge, level 2 grants two, level 3 grants three, level 4 grants four and level 5 grants five arena badges.
As a special service for our most valued customers, we hand out a surprise cube! By using it, you have a chance of getting nice little goodies.
Well, I guess you'd like to know what I'm doing here.
It's my fate to trade potions in exchange for arena badges. Actually my whole family earns its living that way - maybe you'll get to know them someday! ...
You can meet my brothers and sisters by visiting the other arenas.
It's my fate to trade potions in exchange for arena badges. Actually my whole family earns its living that way - maybe you'll get to know them someday! ...
You can meet my brothers and sisters by visiting the other arenas.

It's quite easy. I give you arena badges for each completed arena battle. Surviving 10 waves against monsters in the arena will grant you a fixed amount of badges depending on the difficulty level. ...
You can keep the arena badges or exchange them for each kind of health, mana and spirit potions. I'll charge 1 arena badge for the amount of 100 mana or health potions. ...

100 strong potions of either mana or health will be charged with 2, 100 great health potions with 4 and 100 great mana potions with 3, 100 ultimate potions of either type with 7 and 100 supreme potions with 10 arena badges. ....
You can also select 100 great spirit potions for 4 and 100 ultimate spirit potions for 8 arena badges. ...
Would you like to exchange for health, mana or spirit potions now?
Take care and come back soon!

conversation.Kendra: Welcome on board, Sir <player>. May I sail you to Vigintia Island and the lovely Nostalgia that lies close nearby?

This is a very old island. It magically appeared five years ago and then disappeared again. But now it has returned somehow! It's for sure worth a visit if you want to travel into Tibia's past.
This lovely island is close to Nostalgia. There are a fair, beautiful beaches, some festive diversion and of course enough to eat and drink.

Those are traditionally awarded after having completed a difficult task for our guild.
We are always looking for sniper gloves. They are supposed to raise accuracy. If you find a pair, bring them here. Maybe I can offer you a nice trade.

conversation.Markwin: Oh its you again. What do you want, hornless messenger?

I hate them all. Minotaurs have no own spelling, so I used the speech of the humans. Once I was a prisoner of them. Since then I hate them - and since then I can speak and write in their language.

I am one of the minotaurs that are able to write. So I wrote most of the history of my beloved city Mintwallin in some books.

conversation.A Confused Frog: I don’t want to be an assistant anymore. Ribbit. I just want my dream pond.

Magic, pah. Ribbit. I don’t need magic. I just want some flies, actually. Ribbit.
I used to be Eclesius’ assistant! Argh! Then – ribbit – one of his crazy experimental spells backfired and hit me. That’s when I lost my job I guess. Ribbit.

conversation.Confused Frog: Well… ribbit… my name is Turian. But that doesn’t really matter anymore.

That old fool! He should be locked up with his weird theories and ideas and forced to study some serious magic! Rrrribbit!

conversation.One-Eyed Joe: Ah, the brave adventurer who sought to destroy the evil crystal down there. Have you been successful?
I’m One-Eyed Joe. From Josephina, got that? And I regard this eye patch as a personal feature of beauty!
I’m a pirate. Normally I’m sailing the seas, boarding other ships and gathering treasures. But at the moment my captain graciously assigned me to watch this cursed entrance.
As for myself I haven’t been down there. But I heard some disturbing rumours. In these caves are wonderful crystal formations. Some more poetically inclined fellows call them the crystal gardens. …
At first glance it seems to be a beautiful – and precious – surrounding. But in truth, deep down in these caverns exists an old evil. Want to hear more?

These caves are incredibly beautiful, crystals in vibrant colours grow there like exotic flowers. There are more than a few captains who send down their men in order to quarry the precious crystals. …

But there are few volunteers. Often the crystal gatherers disappear and are never seen again. Other poor fellows then meet their former shipmates in the form of ghosts or skeletons. It’s a cursed area, something evil is down there!

In my humble opinion a pirate should win a fortune by boarding ships, not by crawling through caves and tunnels. But who am I to bring into question the captain’s decision. All I know is that they sell the crystals at a high price. …
A certain amount of the crystals is ground to crystal dust with a special kind of mill. Don’t ask me why. Some kind of magical component perhaps that they sell to mages and sorcerers.
There is something evil in the crystal caves down there. A cursed artefact or something.
Ah, the brave adventurer who sought to destroy the evil crystal down there. Have you been successful?

Protect your ears? Hmm … Wasn’t there some fabulous seafarer who used wax or something to plug his ears? There was a story about horrible bird-women or something …? No, sounds like hogwash, doesn’t it.

conversation.Klaus: There are people who would kill you for rum. Then again there are people who would kill you anyway.

conversation.Chavis: Hey there! You don’t happen to have some food on you, you’re willing to share? Well, where are my manners, a warm welcome for now.

Sorry for not introducing myself. I’m Chavis. <bows

We are only allowed to vote for stuff that is of no interest for the rich guys.

conversation.Zeronex: Hmm? Oh yes, hello. Please, what do you have to report? Any progress?
Yes what? Remind me again about your current mission, please.
Well, that’s the way of science – sometimes, you just have to keep on trying even though it seems there’s no progress at all. Back to work!
Well, it’s not so much as a job, but rather a vocation. I am a research scientist by trade. …
I research the use of heavy glooth gases, or Gloud, as I call it. A rather dangerous job, at that.

Maybe the mixture will work this time! I am sure it can only be a minuscule variation that needs to take place. Then the gloud-filled balloon should be lifted UP, and we achieve non-magical levitation, or airborne travel!
My own invention to indicate gaseous glooth, made up from the words ‘glooth’ and ‘cloud’ – gloud. Gloud will revolutionise research, travel, and everything else!
Don’t you see the implications? Airborne travel would no longer confine us to the boundaries of Oramond with its dangerous cliffs and this devious fog! …
The possibilities to travel, to observe and to learn from a higher vantage point are sheer endless! …
And I shall be the one to give this to the world. It will redeem the name of Pierre Zeronex, and show everyone they were wrong to exclude me from my research, to forbid me the use of my laboratory!

Well, the concoction was nearly right. Nearly. Unfortunately, I had miscalculated the effect that the pressurised gloothine would have on the gaseous mixture and the tank exploded, and… oh well, I really shouldn’t bore you with details. …
<sigh> Sometimes I wonder how much longer I will have to wait for my mission to be successfully concluded.
I had to abandon the old laboratory after the last …incident.

I am certain we have not yet unlocked its full potential. My own experiments lead me to conclude that there is still a lot we do not know about glooth properties and its behaviour when subjected to various treatments.
Hmm, well, first, you should try to talk to Nicholas Cavendish about this so-called ‘strong cloth’. I believe it may lead me on the right path to perfectioning my balloon cover.

I fear the magistrate does not take the forward-looking point of a scientist, but instead reflects the conservative point of view of the common trader. They fear for their merchandise and overlook the risk of cultural stagnation.

conversation.Maro: Hello, fellow hooman. You need tools? Equipment? Ask for a trade if you do.
I am Maro.

I make clocks, fellow hooman, not time.

Ask me for a trade to see my tools.
I was raised in the city by father Alaistar. I live as a hooman. I behave as one. I am one.
The young female hooman? HER voice makes my teeth tingle. I have made ear plugs, they help.
It is an interesting substance that my fellow hoomans use a lot in their tools.
I admire his craftmanship. He makes most beautiful things out of the hard earths and stones.
Sad lady friend of a friend, very much alone. I feel for her.
He makes weapons. He says they are for defense of fellow hoomans. But where there is a weapon, there is an attack. I prefer to make tools.
He has quick hands and a quick tongue. He can write anything and talks very much. But he has become a friend.
He tries to protect the weak. He is a good hooman.
As you see. I am a toolmaker. I make tools.
I don’t know that person.
Uncle is always busy. He does not like to leave his study much. He leaves such things to father and me.
Read the paper. Or ask fellow hooman Fyodor. I do not know. I know how to make tools.
He has interesting ideas for hooman sitting tools. Maro sometimes lends a hand in their construction.
He fights the clans. There is no friendship between him and me.
Choose.
He is a very important hooman in this city. Many listen to him when he speaks. Or maybe it is because he owns the big house of gold coins.
Sad lady friend of a friend, very much alone. I feel for her.
Ah, the lady friend Emily is a wife, or a widow some say. She is sad and alone. If you have a message for her, she will be glad.
Yes. Good bye.

conversation.Fayla: Welcome, dear! Can I help you? Are you looking for an instrument?
The princible sounds good… but is it sound? <smiles> Ah, have I confused you? Sorry, my dear.
Of course, just take a look at my instruments.
I am Madame Fayla Thibault. Call me Fay.
<smiles> Yes, dear? Do you want to buy something?
<smiles> Well then, just ask for a trade and have a look!
During office hours, I sell instruments. In the evenings and by appointment, I teach how to sing and to play an instrument.
Not everyone here can afford his or her own instrument, and I enjoy music. So I made it my duty to teach all who strive to sing and play. After all, music is there to be shared.
Ah, so you heard of me? Well, a lot of time has passed since then, my dear. Glorious days, but it doesn’t do to repine, does it? Of course it doesn’t. <smiles> …
Now, how about a nice little instrument for your home? Just ask me for a trade and I’ll set you right up.
That was a gift from a very mighty and noble friend. Ah, I could never part with it!
I sell only the finest instruments, if you are interested in a trade.
This is an …interesting city, as I am sure you have already noticed. I believe you know glooth?
A strange substance that pervades every aspect of city life. Scientists study it, engineers construct with it… in short, it is used for many purposes.

conversation.Barnabas Dee: Welcome to my humble abode. If you come for new sorcerer spells, you have come to the right place.
Ah, hello there, my young friend. Do you have those pollen I asked for?
I am an astrologer, navigator and mathematician. Oh, and I also teach sorcerer spells.
Sorry, I don’t teach spells for your vocation.
Judging by the height of the sun and the alignment of the stars, it is 10:33 am.
Ah! Did you bring me the peppermoon bell pollen I asked for?

conversation.Flint: Hello, citizen. If you need equipment, ask for a trade.
Make your choice, friend.
I am the local blacksmith. I used to be a soldier and city guard, and the equipment I forge is meant to keep the people safe.
I buy glooth-based equipment, if you have some to sell, ask for a trade.
<grinds teeth> The plague of this island. You will need equipment against them. Ask me for a trade.
One floor upstairs, friend.
Wounded by the minos, eh? Azalea can stitch you up.
Certainly. Ask me for a trade to browse through my stock.
I am interested in buying glooth-based weapons and armors or other local equipment you found. Just ask me for a trade.
Hm, sounds unfamiliar.
It is 11:46 am, citizen.
None of your business.
I am Captain John Flint.
Yes. Exactly.
Lovely voice. Good glooth sandwiches.
Talks a lot. Good soul underneath.
You need knight spells? Go see him in the old barbican. Two houses down the street.
Strange lad. Head full of tapestry and clocks.
Still a beautiful woman. Carried a torch for her in my youth. Heh. Sells instruments now, doesn’t she?
Fancy ideas about minotaurs. Intrepid man, though.
Local druid. Good healer and teacher. Rears some nice flowers, too.
Benign gentleman, keen on gems. Short-sighted like a mole, though.
The toolmaker mino? An exception to the rule.
Only interested in making runes and wands. If you need magical equipment, go see him.
One floor upstairs, friend.
Bank manager. Very influential. Don’t get on his bad side, friend.
Be well, citizen.

conversation.Edmund: Welcome, Sir. Please, take a look and see if something beautiful catches your fancy. Ask me for a trade when you have made your choice.
Why, certainly. Take your time.
<smiles> Well, it’s rather a vocation than a mere job. I am Rathleton’s most renowned jeweller and watchmaker.
Currently you can purchase wedding rings, golden amulets, and ruby necklaces. We also buy gold ingots.
Ah, our newest import! We have golden goblets, silver goblets and bronze goblets. All of them have space for a hand-written dedication.
We don’t trade with them.
There are white and black pearls you can buy or sell, as well as giant green and brown pearls which you can sell.
Ah, the rough creatures that try to overrun our city? I have not much knowledge about them. You should visit Dr Alaistar Stanton, he collects their products and is a known field researcher.
Our city is one full of creative and pragmatic minds. Not unlike myself. <chuckles>
I do not know much about their work, but things in the city seem to run smoothly enough, it seems.
I don’t care much for the hustle and bustle of the outside world. However, if you bring me any gem you find, I might surely know a way how to turn it into a unique jewel!
You can buy and sell small diamonds, sapphires, rubies, emeralds and amethysts or sell topazes.
Of course. Ask me for a trade to have a look at our exquisite pieces.
It is 6:02 am, precisely. Would you care for a wrist watch? I have one there, or could make you a most fetching one.
I am Master Edmund Orlond.
A quiet man. Very given to his work as a blacksmith.
Young Lady D’Albay seems a good-natured girl. She always brings me fresh cookies when she comes to marvel at my jewellery.
Yound Fairfax? He runs the Post Office now, I heard. He is also the editor of the Oramond Observer, a very critical paper. But ah, today’s youth. <smiles mildly>

Ah, she was most beautiful in her youth! Well, time is not kind to any of us, and since the opera house burned down, I believe she has had to resort to giving singing and piano lessons, and to selling instruments in her little shop across the plaza.

Ah, what a shame about young Henry Merlay! <shakes head> Such interesting ideas! Such marvellous golem design! If that accident hadn’t cost him his life, I believe this city would look different today.
Dr Stanton is a most famous researcher on Oramondian flora and fauna, and a potions specialist. When he’s not out collecting information, he runs a shop just over the street.
Who? No!… – Oh, and I thought he had a lovely tan, though a little coarse features! Well, perhaps I should wear my glasses in public.
Professor Stanton is unsurpassed in the art of creating runes and wands. You should visit his Magic Emporium if you wish to purchase magical equipment.
Mordecai and Alaistar Stanton are renowned men in Rathleton, and experts of their craft. Their specialty lies with the more practical arts of magic, rune-baking and potion creation.
I heard he won quite some prizes in archer contests, and is a most succesful minotaur hunter. Naturally, it runs in the family. And bowmaking is virtually their second nature.
Mr Carefew was so kind as to suggest I take up my working quarters in the bank, seeing as it is the safest building, and my works are quite precious.
Bid you good day, Sir.

conversation.Christine: Welcome, sweetheart! Want a bite to eat? I’ll trade!
Sure, here’s our menu!
We used to have one, but after that dreadful fire one day it was torn down and an experimental glooth factory was established instead. …
That didn’t go well, either; the factory’s been closed for years and the whole area is, quite frankly, gone to rack and ruin. I’d love to rebuild the opera, though. <sighs>
The stuff Rathleton’s dreams are made of! <winks> Seriously, honey, I make some delicious sandwiches and steaks out of it. Ask me for a trade to find out for yourself!
I’d be delighted to sell you something! Ask me for a trade to see our list of delicious resfreshments and provisions.
Hmm, yes, I see the idea, but does it work? It’s just an idea so far. I’d like to see such a cloth.
Really? How romantic! We haven’t had a king or queen for a long time. It really didn’t work for us, I don’t know why. Maybe the historian or some old history book of his can tell you more.
Your lands sound fascinating! When I get married, I will make sure my husband takes me for a honeymoon there.
Traditionally, it’s Miss D’Albay, but you may call me Christine. <flashes you a smile>

Grandmother Christine was a fabulous baker and even continued to run the shop when she was married. That annoyed quite some elder people in the higher society! But if it hadn’t been for her, things would never have moved in this city.
Father thinks I have too many fancy ideas and that I will quietly settle down once I’m married. <winks> Well, I believe I will continue just fine the way I am!

He can be so funny! And the way he talks about his ideas for the city! Father disapproves of him, of course. But I think this place could go much forward if Fyodor had a say in matters. Is it true he vistied your capital city? What’s it like there?
Lady Balfour’s son? He lives for his duties as a knight. When his father disappeared, mother dropped the acquaintance entirely.
He’s a true artist of interior design! Mother had all of our mansion’s rooms refurnished according to his plans.
Oh, Madame Fay is such a great singer! I take lessons there, I hope one day I’ll be as accomplished as her. She was very famous in her youth. …
She sang the leading roles in the Opera House before it was torn down. If I make enough money some day, I’ll have it rebuilt, no matter what father says! …
Dr Stanton is such an interesting man! Did you know he goes out there into the wild, fearless, and studies Oramonds wilderness? What a man!

She’s nice, but she does not go out much. I think she’s a little shy with people. The only thing we ever talked about was her flowers. They are lovely though, you should have a look when you’re at the temple!
He makes the most gorgeous jewellery you can imagine. I love to visit him, just to look at his wares! If I ever get married, I will make sure to buy at least half of his stock at once!
He keeps to himself. What a tragic hero! He saved so many, but his own friend he could not save – is this not like in one of the great novels?
That minotaur that Dr Stanton brought with him from the fields? I believe he is not very musical.
I was quite afraid of him as a child, his bushy eyebrows and his mumbling always made me think of an evil sorcerer! But he’s quite a nice old man, even if he’s a little distracted.

Mother would love for me to marry into the family. The D’Arbalesses are one of the oldest families on the island. At least, one of the oldest that we know of. Some even say that they’re descended from elves! <laughs>
He’s a great friend of father’s. Very respectable, and a bore through and through! ‘Money this, glooth papers that…’ – it’s time for a fresh breeze in this stuffy city!
Bye, bye, love!

conversation.Silas: Hello, friend. If you need bows or spears, ammunition or paladin spells, then ask for a trade.
I am a hunter and trainer of hunters. And I teach paladin spells to those of my kind.
You seem staggered by it. The invention of glooth added to the uniqueness of our city, I believe - there is no glooth in your lands, I understand?
A strange substance, gained, I think through some sort of process from an animal. Our historian in the magistrate, or Dr Alaistar Stanton, can surely explain it better to you than I can.
A kind and intelligent man, but too naive in his dealings with the minotaurs. You'd better purchase some sturdy bow if you go out there to their camps, friend.
Those brutish creatures cannot share the island with us. We should eradicate their kind, once and for all, or we shall never be safe.

conversation.Virgil: Good day to you, Sir. How may I be of assistance? Bank business, perhaps?
We can change money for you. You can also access your bank account or your guild account options.

There are three different coin types in Tibia: 100 gold coins equal 1 platinum coin, 100 platinum coins equal 1 crystal coin. So if you’d like to change 100 gold into 1 platinum, simply say ‘change gold’ and then ‘1 platinum’.
Every Tibian has one. The big advantage is that you can access your money in every branch of the Tibian Bank! …
Would you like to know more about the basic functions of your bank account, the advanced functions, or are you already bored, perhaps?
You can check the balance of your bank account, deposit money or withdraw it. You can also transfer money to other characters, provided that they have a vocation and are not on Dawnport.
Your bank account will be used automatically when you want to rent a house or bid on an item on the market. Let me know if you want to know about how either one works.
I think you must be one of the richest inhabitants of Tibia! Your account balance is 16552758 gold.
You don’t have any gold with you.
Please tell me how much gold you would like to withdraw.
Please tell me the amount of gold you would like to transfer.
Renting a house has never been this easy. Simply make a bid for an auction on the house section of the official Tibia website. We will check immediately if you have enough money …

Please keep in mind that the sum you have used to bid will be unavailable unless somebody places a higher bid. Once you have acquired a house the rent will be charged automatically from your bank account every month.

If you buy an item from the market, the required gold will be deducted from your bank account automatically. On the other hand, money you earn for selling items via the market will be added to your account. It’s easy!

Those creatures are a constant threat. I am glad that our city guards take care of protecting the city against their continual raids! However, if you could spare some time, I am sure some assistance would not come amiss.
What a modern idea. I see no practical use at present.
Dr Stanton is one of our most renown researchers in the fields of magical liquids and Oramondian botany. …

He has written extensive works on the minotaurs especially, and thinks it possible to communicate with them. <sniffs> Imagine that! Communicate with our enemies! It needs a scientific mind like Dr Stanton’s to have such a … peacable notion.
Our local historian is well versed in our city’s past. Feel free to visit him – or to read through our library in the magistrate.
Mr Dee has a somewhat unusual hobby – he is an astrologer. Or was it astronomer? Please excuse me, I am not an adept in these things. Ah yes, and he also teaches sorcerer spells.
Okay okay, no need to be rude! It seems you already know everything.
We can change money for you. You can also access your bank account or your guild account options.
We may be interested in trading further goods and glooth products, but that will be voted on by the magistrate.
Young Miss D’Albay indulges in running a little business these days, but I am certain you will find her glooth sandwiches to your taste.
The wealth of our city. Did you know that it is of animal origin? There is a book about it somewhere, I am sure.
Ruled by a king? We had a princess, once. Ah, that was long ago. Primitive times.
I am sorry, I do not discuss other clients’ matters with a third, as a rule.
Ah, yes. Mr Orlond has rented the upper storey. You will find there a selection of the finest Oramondian jewellery.
The new factory will surely prove beneficial to Rathleton’s financial success.
Ah. <coldly> Our local post officer and news editor. I believe you will find him quite outspoken on political matters of Oramond, if a little inclined to drama.

I am unable to relate the exact sayings of the lower caste to you, but I believe that most gossips emerge from the older part of town. Ask someone in any tavern there, and you will hear all the sailor’s yarn you can possibly wish for.
Our local knight trainer. <sniffs> He does a fairly good job, or so I am told. Please excuse me, I have pressing matters to attend to.
I am the director of the Oramond Island Bank.
Yes, the magistrate executes the will of the people. It is a most remarkable institution. If you wish to learn more about our city, you should visit Barazbaz, the magistrate’s historian.

That minotaur Dr Stanton brought with him from a field trip is a constant source of danger, a threat to our city! Sadly, Dr Stanton perseveres in a most unfortunate naivete regarding his ‘foster-son’.

Those creatures are a constant threat. I am glad that our city guards take care of protecting the city against their continual raids! However, if you could spare some time, I am sure some assistance would not come amiss.
He turned evil and built a golem army to destroy the city. But he was stopped.
Professor Stanton is an expert on runes and wands. He used to teach sorcerer spells as well, but has now left that post to his close friend, Mr Barnabas Dee.
Virgil Carefew, at your service.
The name runs in our family since generations, and is traditionally given to the firstborn son.
I read in the Oramond Observer that gloothomir papers are still in high demand,whereas the gloothine seems to be suffering a sudden loss of favour.
You can transfer money from your account to the account of a guild via player guild transfer. If you are a member of a guild, you can deposit money on its account via guild deposit. …
If you are leader or vice leader of a guild, you can also withdraw gold from your guild account via guild withdraw or use a guild transfer to transfer money from your guild to another guild. …
As a leader or vice leader of a guild you can also transfer money from your guild account to a player account via guild player transfer. …
Please keep in mind that we may need some time to process such requests.
A very ancient family of impeccable repute. Silas, the youngest son, is a proficiant bowmaker and learned paladin trainer. You should visit his shop if you need ammunition.

The lower part of the city is, sadly, quite derelict. It used to be the heart of the older Rathleton town, but times have changed, and with the discovery of glooth, some have prospered and some have not. …
Nowadays, only the poor and destitute live there. However, rents in the lower part of town are low, which is why scientists and tradesmen continue to run their business near the harbour.
It is 5:58 am, precisely.
An energetic man, and also the captain of the city guards. If you wish to undertake a mission for the city, he is the man to talk to.
Enjoy your day, Sir.

conversation.Gnomette: Ah, another visitor about to enjoy the marvels of gnomish ingenuity. Hello and welcome to the GCTS!
It is the amazing gnomish crystal teleport system! And I of course am here to help our new recruits! You can also ask me for a trade if you are in need of teleport crystals for the GCTS.
So are you here to become a recruit?

Excellent! I am so excited about all you big people who want to join. So you can now proceed to the recruitment office that is downstairs and that I marked on your map. But you probably need to know what this all is about first!

So where to begin? Oh, I know! I am a gnome! And I am not the only one! Don’t panic though, we are peaceful, I promise! Of course if I’d be evil then I’d say just the same. Oh boy, we have quite a dilemma here! …
But let us assume that I am not evil, that is, of course I am not evil, what I mean is give me the benefit of the doubt. …
So we are the gnomes! And we are good people! Which is quite obvious since we are small. We live underground and usually mind our own gnomish business. …
Which is mostly about crystals and mushrooms, but that is probably not of interest for you now. Well, we are peaceful as I said, but not all underground dwellers are that peaceful, you know? …
We handled most of them with our own resources, but recently an old, faceless enemy regained power and the threat it poses has stretched our resources so thin …
that even things that we usually handle on a casual basis now pose a serious problem. This is where you come into play. Well that is if you become a bigfoot.
The underground is a dangerous place even in the best of times. These are not remotely the best of times though. …
We fight an enormous threat that we call those below and this war drains all our resources, so that all kind of underground monsters threaten our holdings.
We don’t know who the driving force is, but we encounter their warriors and bases in the underground.
Though they sometimes employ tamed monsters that are common in the underground, their foremost warriors are the lost and abominable magma creatures.
Their ancestors were probably dwarfs who became enslaved ages ago. What is left after all these years of breeding and conditioning is hardly a dwarf at all. They are murderous savages beyond compare.

They can be anything, from golems to elementals. What we know is that they are dangerous and fiercely loyal to their masters. They are magma creatures and employ a range of fiery attacks. They are strong and fearless and a great threat to us.
The Bigfoot company is a troop we are assembling. It is supposed to help us in our efforts to fight the threats to gnomekind.
Well, yes. We figured that you might need some human contact person. To be honest, you big ones are a bit weird sometimes and a human can handle other humans a bit better than we could. …
So there is Commander Stone, he is the highest ranking bigfoot and he will be your contact person later on.
I’m here to help our new recruits! You can also ask me for a trade if you are in need of teleport crystals for the GCTS.
The gnomish people are free-spirited though somewhat reclusive towards outsiders.

We have been allied with the dwarf for centuries. Our transfer of knowledge and resources has been quite low though. Sometimes we help each other out. More often than not we will ignore each other and mind our own business. …
In the last few years though it has become more and more evident that we have common goals and common foes. This build quite strong alliances. …
We provided the dwarfs with gnomish crystal cultivating knowledge. Only to some extent of course. …
The dwarfs on the other hand supplied us with metal goods, armor and weapons and have of late introduced us to their allies, that is people like you. …
That was when we decided to raise an army made up of volunteers from the outside. Something new and revolutionary in gnomish history.
Crystals resonate at a certain frequency. If two crystals share the exact frequency they are bound to each other. They share not only the frequency but also other properties, …

foremost the same place in time and space, although this might seem physically impossible to an ungnomish mind. If a user now steps on our teleport platforms and has been harmonized with the teleporter in question once, …
then he will harmonize with the teleporter’s frequency and seemingly allow him to travel from one crystal platform to its corresponding counterpart. …
Understood? Of course you have! After all it was explained to you by a gnome!!! This gnome happens to be me by the way, just in case you didn’t notice!
Mushrooms are one of our major resources. We have cultivated and bred different forms of mushrooms for different purposes. To us they are far from being merely a food source. …

Mushrooms are grown to supply us with tools or even fabric. Gnomish mushroom wool and gnomish mushroom linen are an important resource for the gnomish economy. We can even substitute your overworld wood with our mushrooms.
I never was there but it seems to be some kind of huge city. So I imagine there are a lot of mushroom huts and people are singing and dancing all day long.
Well, yes. We figured that you might need some human contact person. To be honest, you big ones are a bit weird sometimes and a human can handle other humans a bit better than we could. …
So there is Commander Stone, he is the highest ranking bigfoot and he will be your contact person later on.

They can be anything, from golems to elementals. What we know is that they are dangerous and fiercely loyal to their masters. They are magma creatures and employ a range of fiery attacks. They are strong and fearless and a great threat to us.
Good bye!
